loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Los Girasoles”  está conformada por 08 socios que han ido mejorando en el transcurso del tiempo a través de  sus negocios. Este es el caso de Vilma de 50 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos independientes. Hace más de 20 años que Vilma comenzó vendiendo tamales donde también vende caldo de gallina. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio y así mismo poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos. El crédito que solicitó lo invertirá para la compra de maíz, aceite, carne de pollo y fideos. El grupo “Los Girasoles” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Vilma se encuentra en la parte frontal es la tercera del lado derecho  viste chaleco marrón y polo celeste.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Girasoles" consists of 8 members who have been improving their lives over time through their businesses.

This is the story of Vilma, 50 years old, who is separated and has 2 grown-up children. More than 20 years ago, Vilma started selling tamales and also chicken broth. As a result of her efforts, she could improve her business and provide a better education for her children. 

She asks for a loan to invest it in the purchase of corn, oil, chicken and noodles. The group "Los Girasoles" are thankful for the loans and promise to continue their hard work. Vilma is in the front of the picture, she is the third from the right and is wearing a brown vest and a blue polo.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, chicken, and noodles

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en:
Aseel is a 19-year-old single young lady from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her father works as a taxi driver, which gives him a good income, but not a stable one. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Aseel is a student who is studying finance. She would like to earn the BA degree and find a job in the future.

Aseel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Aseel will be able to complete her studies and find a job faster.

Aseel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Enma De Jesus

texts.es:
Enma de 57 años de edad, por falta de recursos no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada y su compañero de vida es agricultor, tienen dos hijos de 38 años de edad y 41 años de edad, también tienen un nieto que vive con ellos.

Enma, toda su vida se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos y le ayuda a su pareja en las labores agrícolas, tiene una parcela sembrada con maíz, todos los días camina cerca de 30 minutos para llegar a ella y trabajarla desde las 6:00 am hasta las 4:00pm

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizante y herbicida, otra parte será utilizada en la contratación de un trabajador para que se encargue del cultivo. 
Enma espera Dios le preste vida para ver crecer a su nieto y tener la  fuerza para seguir ayudándole a su esposo en las labores agrícolas.
texts.en:
Enma is 57 years old. Due to a lack of resources, she was unable to go to school. She is married and her life's companion is a farmer. She has two children, aged 38 and 41. She also has a grandson who lives with them. 

For her whole life, Enma has worked as a housewife and has helped her spouse with the farm work. She has a land parcel planted with corn. Every day she walks close to 30 minutes to get there and she works from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and herbicide. Another part will be used to hire labor to do the planting. Enma hopes God will give her life to see her grandson grow and be strong enough to keep helping her husband with the farm work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor costs for the planting.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Juana de 42 años de edad, debido a que su familia no contaba con los recursos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos educativos, solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado de educación básica, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, uno tiene hogar aparte y  3 hijas  viven con ella y estudian. Dependen económicamente de ella aunque ocasionalmente trabajan.

Juana es empleada, trabaja como  ordenanza y lleva 11 años desempeñándo dicho cargo, camina 15 minutos desde su casa hasta el trabajo, todos los días de 7:00 am hasta las 4:00 pm. En su casa tiene un pequeño negocio en el que vende helados y paletas.

El préstamo será utilizado para pagar los derechos de graduación de una de sus hijas, con ello obtendrá el título de bachiller y podrá continuar sus estudios en la universidad y terminar una carrera.
texts.en:
Juana, 42, could only study up to the fourth grade of elementary school because her family could not afford to pay for her education.  She is the single mother of four children; one is independent and lives with her/his family, and the others are of school age and live with her. Although they sometimes work, they depend on her.

Juana has worked as an administrative assistant for eleven years. She works every day from 7:00 am until 4:00 pm and she has to walk for fifteen minutes to go to her workplace. She sells ice cream and popsicles at home.

She will use this loan to cover the graduation costs of one of her daughters. She will receive the Bachelor’s degree and will be able to continue with her studies at the university level.

loans.use: to cover her daughter's graduation costs.

loans.name: Juan Alexander

texts.es:
Juan es un joven emprendedor, soltero de 21 años y vive en Pisco junto a su familia. Cuando Juan terminó el colegio tuvo que priorizar las necesidades que había en su familia y por falta de recursos económicos empezó a trabajar, es por ello que desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como albañil y cree que le va bien porque siempre se esfuerza y trabaja duro para sacar adelante su familia. Le gusta el idioma inglés, es por ello que se ha inscrito a clases de inglés para poder aprender este idioma. Sin dudas Juan se merece todo lo mejor porque siempre piensa en los demás antes que en sí mismo.
Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un televisor para su casa y pintarrajear las paredes. Con esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y continuará esforzándose. Más adelante Juan quier empezar a estudiar la carrera de Computación para poder tener mejores oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Juan is an enterprising young man. He is single, 21 years old, and lives with his family in Pisco. When Juan finished school, he had to set his family's needs as a priority and, for lack of economic resources, started to work. This is why he has worked as a bricklayer for more than 1 year. He thinks that he does well in his job, because he always strives and works hard to get his family ahead. He likes the English language and has started taking lessons to learn this language.

Without any doubt, Juan deserves the best because he always thinks of others first before he thinks of himself. Juan is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their help he will be able to buy a TV for his house and to plaster the walls.

loans.use: to buy a TV, and to plaster the walls of his house.

loans.name: Cruz Jackeline

texts.es:
Cruz Jackeline es conviviente, reside en el caserio Buenos Aires junto a su esposo e hijo. Ella cuenta con servicios públicos(agua y luz); viven en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, costa norte de Perú. Cruz Jackeline es natural de la zona, su comunidad es pequeña y los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado, comercio y al comercio de platano.

La actividad que desarrolla Cruz Jackeline es la siembra y comercialización de platano y mano de obra por parte de su esposo, ella necesita el crédito para abonar su chacra, lo que le asegurará una cosecha saludable y un producto en mejores condiciones que le permitirá venderlo a un mejor precio, aumentando de esta manera sus ingresos, mejorando sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cruz Jackeline is in a relationship. She lives in a village called Buenos Aires together with her husband and her son. Her house is connected to the electricity and water distribution systems. This village is located in the Buenos Aires district, Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru. Cruz Jackeline was born there. She is a member of a small community. Locals work raising animals, selling banana and in commerce in general.

Cruz Jackeline grows and sells banana, helped by her husband. She needs this loan to spread fertilizer over her plantations, which will result in a healthy harvest and a high-quality produce. She will be able to increase her prices, which will result in a higher income, better profits, and better living conditions for her.

loans.use: to spread fertilizers over her plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a crib for his son.

loans.name: Jogasnis Lisbeth

texts.es:
Jogasnis Lisbeth tiene 24 años de edad, su estado civil es Soltera y sin carga familiar; vive en casa familiar de material rustico en el caserio Laynas, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito de la Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Jogasnis Lisbeth es la venta de cerveza y comida(ceviches, piqueos), actividad que realiza hace 2 años, contando ya con clientela fija. Ella necesita del crédito para la compra de cerveza(incluidas cajas), mesas y sillas; esto le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos dado que podrá atender en mejores condiciones a sus clientes. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido que en la actualidad se esta cosechando el arroz y empresa Natucultura estan contratando personal.
texts.en:
Jogasnis Lisbeth is 24 years old and single. She has no children and lives with a relative in a house made with rustic materials in a village called Laynas. Locals work raising animals, in agriculture, and in commerce in general. The house where she lives is connected to the water and electricity distribution networks. The community is located in the Matanza district, Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Jogasnis Lisbeth has been selling beer and food (ceviches [a seafood dish] and snacks) for two years, and she has a fixed customer base. She needs this loan to buy beer (including the boxes in which they are transported), tables and chairs. This will help her to increase her income since she will be able to better serve her customers. The local market conditions are good now that locals are growing rice and a company called Natucultura is hiring people.

loans.use: to buy beer, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin has a motorcycle transport business and has been in this business for 10 years now. He is 28-years-old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child.

He will be using this loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to renovate his house so it can be in good condition.

This is Edwin's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Rebeca is a businesswoman running poultry activities for five months. She raises 200 laying-chickens and is able to collect more than 150 eggs per day. She is a single lady in her twenties. She introduced herself to business after finishing school. Rebeca would like to be the poultry lady rising up to 1,000 laying chickens. Working from 6am to 5pm daily, she is able to make a good profit each month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request to be apportioned among Juhudi, a nine member group. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Rebeca will use her portion of the loan to buy chickens for her business. She dreams to be successful in her life.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is a 25-year-old married businesswoman from Mudzi District, Zimbabwe. With her family’s assistance, Rachel runs a poultry project at the local business center. She produces 50 broiler birds every 6 weeks. When she is not selling chickens, Rachel works as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at a nearby school where she helps young students with cooperative learning. With the Kiva loan, Rachel intends to make bulk purchases of chicks, vaccines, and feed to boost production volumes and thus increase profits. With the money she will earn, Rachel will be able to provide for her family and pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of chicks, vaccines, and feed to boost production volumes

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 57-year-old married father of three children, a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp.  Due to the low social and financial situations of the refugees in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps and their limited work access, Jamal decided to provide transportation services to  employees and students with his car to increase his income and thus, cover his family’s needs and living expenses.

Jamal is now acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to make necessary maintenance to his car which is considered the only income source for his family.  He hopes to improve his work and buy a new car to attract customers and provide them with better services.

loans.use: To make the necessary maintenance to his car

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su conyuge y su menor hijo, en casa alquilada, posee terreno propio donde cultiva café de la variedad Catimor, su comunidad es habita por personas tranquilas y trabajadoras, dedicas en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el dsitrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

José se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace 5 años, en el caserio de Ahuyaca. Él necesita del crédito para la compra de abonos para realizar la fertilizacion de sus fincas, lo que le va a permitir incrementar sus rendimientos, y asi poder tener una cosecha saludable y un producto de calidad, lo que permitirá aumentar sus ingresos ya que lo podrá ofrecer a un mejor precio, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old. He lives with his partner and a small son in a rented house. He has his own plot where he grows Catimor coffee.

In the area where he lives, the people are quiet and hard-working. Most of them work in agriculture and cattle-raising. This community is located in the district of Colasay, in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region, on the north coast of Peru.

José works growing coffee. He has done this for five years, in the village of Ahuyaca. He needs a loan to buy manure in order to fertilize his fields, as this will enable him to increase his profit and to have a healthy crop and a quality product. By this, he will increase his income, because he will be able to sell the coffee at a better price, increase his profit and by this his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Silindiwe

texts.en:
Silindiwe is a 19-year-old businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. She is working as a Camfed Learner guide volunteer at the local secondary school. In addition, Silindiwe rents a table at the nearby flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Silindiwe will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 19-year-old businesswoman from Shurugwi District, Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothes for men and women for three months. Apart from running her business, Patricia serves as a community health activist who disseminates health information to the people of her community; she is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer, as well. With the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, Patricia intends to make bulk purchases of clothes so that she would be able to sell the items at favourable prices and benefit from increased sales and profits. With the additional profits, Patricia intends to go back to school.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en: Tracy is a married mother of one from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She sells clothing and accessories for a living so that she can take care of her family. Additionally, Tracy is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school; she teaches sessions on life skills and cooperative learning to students. Tracy is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can make bulk purchases of clothes to increase her sales and profits. Tracy’s hope is to open a clothing shop in her community one day.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of clothes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 33-year-old businesswoman. She is a single mother who has been operating a small grocery shop in Mudzi District, Zimbabwe since January of this year. Susan also volunteers as a community health development officer and a Camfed Learner Guide in her community. With the loan from Kiva, Susan intends to increase her stock to improve sales and profits. A higher income would make it easier for Susan to support her child.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 24-year-old businesswoman who lives in Buhera District, Zimbabwe. She is a Learner Guide volunteer who teaches life skills to secondary school students. In addition, Faith rents a shop where she sells products such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, soap, kapenta, royco, and drinks. She has been running this business for nineteen months and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Faith will purchase more cooking oil, sugar, salt, soap, kapenta, royco, and drinks to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. She also intends to employ other people.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood bars for his construction work.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 26-year-old married mother of one child. A year ago, Fatima started to work as a tutor from her house to help her husband in covering their family’s increasing living needs and expenses.

Today, Fatima is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy new furniture in an attempt to make her house a healthier place for her beloved child, and at the same time more facilitating for her students to be more comfortable during their session.

Fatima hopes to open her own special tutoring center in the future, which will increase her income and provide her beloved family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To renew her furniture to facilitate her students' tutorial session needs

loans.name: Xay's Group

texts.en:
Xay is 53 years old and lives with his two children and wife. His wife is a worker in a local company. For the past five years, Xay has been running a business of making moulds and a variety of plastic products to earn an income to support his family. Xay is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, he is on the right wearing a white shirt. Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities.

Xay is requesting a loan to purchase a larger quantity and better quality of plastic materials to make moulds and plastic products. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional ones. He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity and better quality of plastic materials to make moulds and plastic products

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as foods and beverages to sell from her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products such as foods and beverages to sell from her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Muharakani Group

texts.en:
Gertrude, who is in her early 60's, is a widow and has two grown-up children. She is staying with one grandchild who goes to school.  She has been running a business of different types of home birds since 2014. She works from 6 AM to 5 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Gertrude's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to  buy eggs for turkeys, ducks, and local chickens to hatch more home birds, and also to buy piglets and grow them into big pigs to sell. She dreams of increasing her home bird stocks.

Gertrude will share this loan with her loan group, Muharakani,  which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy eggs for turkeys, ducks, and local chickens, and also to buy piglets and make them into big pigs to sell.

loans.name: Spiwe

texts.en:
Spiwe is a 29-year-old businesswoman, wife, and mother. She resides in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. Over the last year, Spiwe has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 25 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2010 because she wanted to be financially independent. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. 

Spiwe started her business because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. She would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent. Spiwe also wants to improve the quality of her son’s life.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan, a 28-year-old married mother of two children, started four years ago to work as a hairdresser from her house to help her husband in covering their family’s increasing living needs and expenses.

Suzan is well-known in her region for being professional and creative in her domain. For this reason, she is now acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to open her own beauty salon and buy necessary tools, which represents a good step forward towards developing her business and increasing her family’s income.

Suzan hopes to improve her income through her new beauty salon and thus provide her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: To open her own beauty salon and buy necessary tools

loans.name: Atiya's Group

texts.en:
Khurshid is a housewife and is blessed with three children. Her husband is in the business of selling gemstones. He buys gemstones from the market and, after refurbishing them, resells the precious stones to jewelers.  

Due to rising prices, it has become extremely difficult for her husband to expand his business. Whatever profits he earns, he spends them in his home just to make ends meet. Therefore, through this loan Khurshid would help her husband buy a new and larger stock of the precious stones, so that he can make more profit and handle the household expenses as well reinvest the remaining profit into his business.

loans.use: To buy precious gemstones for reselling.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is thankful that she was granted a 14,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase frozen foods, beverages, and other grocery items needed in her business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like now to apply for another 16,000 PHP which she will use to buy more processed meats, frozen foods, and beverages to add to her inventory. She also sells popular brands of  personal products on the side.  More items displayed at the store will result in more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from this business helps meet their daily living expense.

Anita aims to grow her business so she could save for her senior years. She desires to live long and be healthy.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for processed frozen foods, beverages,  and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Comoro Group

texts.en:
Eugen is in his 30s, is single and has one son who is in school. For eight years now, he has run several businesses, which include a shop selling dry foods, an electronics shop selling electrical goods, and M-pesa. Eugen has few helpers in his businesses. He works from 7 am to 11 pm daily and is able to realize a good profit each month.

This is his second loan request with Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to replenish his food shop with food items and to recharge his M-pesa float. He used the previous loan, since repaid successfully, to buy stock for his shops and to recharge his M-pesa float. Eugen uses his profits to cover school fees and household expenses. He dreams of growing his enterprises.

Eugen will share this loan with his loan group, Comoro, which consists of two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his food shop with food items and to recharge his M-pesa float.

loans.name: Courtesy

texts.en:
Courtesy is a 28-year-old businesswoman and mother of one. She is divorced and lives in Shurugwi District, Zimbabwe. 

For the past five months, Courtesy has been selling a variety of clothing to members of her community. She was encouraged by her mother to venture into this business. When she is not working at her business, Courtesy serves as a Camfed volunteer. She is a Learner Guide who teaches secondary school students communication skills. 

With the requested loan from Kiva, Courtesy intends to make bulk purchases of clothes and boost her sales and profits. With additional profits, Courtesy hopes to expand her business and create employment opportunities in her community. Courtesy’s priority is to provide for her child.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang is a 55-year-old widowed woman. She lives with two children in Ho Chi Minh City. For nine years, she has run a business of selling coffee and making rice griddle cakes for people in her community.

She would like a loan to purchase new furniture for her cafe and to buy better quality ingredients to make food to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Lang also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her cafe and better quality ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 42 years old single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh city.

She has been supporting her family by selling meals in the local community for 10 years. She would like to take a loan to increase the working capital for her business which will enable her to buy better food to sell at higher margins. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better food to sell at higher margins.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, a 36-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working as a driver. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Hong requests a loan to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder, and shampoo, to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder, and shampoo, to stock her store

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 47-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. 

She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 10 years. Thuy would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is an existing franchisee with Fresh Life Initiative. He built his first toilets earlier on and has been impressed by the impact on sanitation in the community. He hopes to see more improvement and is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase and run two additional Fresh Life Toilets. He has been able to employ more than one person to help him run his facility and wishes he could create more employment opportunities. He hopes to see growth in his franchise and plans to purchase more facilities once he has cleared his loan.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is 51 year old, widowed, and she has two children. She is only breadwinner in a family. She operates ar clothing sales business, which she has been doing for 19 years.  She trades with different clothing supplies from her house and earns an income, which is very important for the family's living.  

Samira requested her seventh loan, which she will use to purchase a large amount of clothes. This loan will help her to expand her business and earn a greater income.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothes

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 22 years old and single. He is from Beddya, a village near Nablus City. He works in a carpentry workshop he owns, which he  has been doing for three years. it is a good business but the income is not stable due to demand. 

Ghassan requested a loan from FATEN, which he will use to buy a new electrical saw for his carpentry work. With this loan, he will be able to increase his productivity and income. Ghassan would like to open a bigger workshop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new electrical saw for his carpentry work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the administrative fees to get her title.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Mohamed. He is married, and has four children aged 1, 9, 11 and 14. In 2009, Mohamed established his building materials business. He began his business just to be self-reliant and support the home. His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy locks and electrical appliances. He hopes that this loan will increase the stock and expand the business. In the future, Mohamed plans to educate the children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Sarah. She is married.

In 2007, Sarah established her school bags business. She began her business because she wants to give support to her husband. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are adults. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,517,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Sarah requires a loan in order to buy additional school bags. She hopes that this loan can increase her stock and generate more income. In the future, Sarah plans to relocate to a much bigger market. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy school bags to resell.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en: Abida is married and has five children. She requested a loan, which her husband will use to purchase a new carriage for his rickshaw. The new carriage would attract more customers and increase Abida's husband earnings thereby helping Abida to send her children to school. Similarly, these earnings would be used by Abida to improve the standard of living of her household.

loans.use: to purchase a new carriage for the rickshaw.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Regina. She is married and has one child, aged 10. She has three additional dependents, who live with her to assist in their schooling.  

In 1999, Regina established her provisions and cooking condiments business. She began her business to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,050,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Regina requires a loan to buy cooking oil and onions. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase the stock and expand the business. In the future, Regina plans to be able to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff for her shop

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Alusine. He is married and has three children, age 5, 10 and 16. He has two additional dependents who live with him, helping him with his business.  

In 2004, Alusine established his building materials business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant after coming from the mines. His business is located at city center and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 940,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Alusine has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now he requires a new loan in order to buy cement and iron rods. He hopes that this loan will increase the stock and expand the business.

In the future, Alusine plans to expand the business to other parts of the town. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: to pay for cement and iron rods.

loans.name: Ghulam  Bibi

texts.en: Ghulam Bibi is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns one buffalo. However, the income generated is not enough to bear her household expenses; therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase another buffalo. She is in her fifth loan cycle. She is hopeful that the increase in milk production will help her in generating greater income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Alice.  She is married. In 2009, Alice established her bowls, baskets, and cool-man business. She began her business because she wants to give support to her husband. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working six days a week and 12 hours-a-day, she earns about SLL 1,505,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Alice requires a loan in order to buy flasks, cool-man and bowls. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock and generate more income. In the future, Alice plans to own a shop and to get one assistant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for flask, cool man and bowls

loans.name: Donald S.

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Donald. He is married and has two children, age 3 years and 3 months. 

In 2009, Donald established his electronics (television, DVD and home theater) business. Donald learned doing business from his brother, and he thinks business is the only way for him to take care of his family. His main customers are adults.

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Donald requires a loan in order to buy additional televisions, DVD players and home theater items. He hopes that this loan will add to his present stock and increase his profit. In the future, Donald plans to buy a piece of land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for televisions, DVD players and home theater items.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, 33, is a mother of five children. She is very hardworking. 

In order to provide for her family, she and her husband opened up a general store. With the help of income from this store, Naseem has been able to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR. With this loan she wants to buy stock of oil, jams, packed juices and grains to meet the increasing demand in her store. She has high hopes of a rise in income, which she wants to spend on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy stock of oil, jams, packed juices and grains.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Isatu. She is married. 

In 2009, Isatu established her soft drinks, malt drinks and ginger beer business. She began her business because she wants to help sustain her family. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are all ages. 

Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,375,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy additional crates of soft drinks and bags of sugar for her ginger beer. She hopes that this loan can improve on the business and generate more income. 

In the future, Isatu plans to put up a building that will accommodate more refrigerators and thereby accommodate more customers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Rangi Tatu Group

texts.en:
Mwema is in her 40s and has got two schooling children. She is not married. 

For two years now, she has had a business of mamalishe, selling soft drinks, breakfast and lunch foods. Working from 4 a.m. to mid day, she is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her second loan request via Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use it to replenish her mamalishe with cooking ingredients such as cooking oil, rice, beans, etc. and charcoal. She used the previous loan, since repaid, to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, maize and baking flour, juices, sodas and waters. She earned a profit that she used to pay school fees and household expenses. Mwema also bought home a TV and a DVD deck. She dreams that one day she will be able to improve her business.
 
She will share this loan with her loan group,"Rangi Tatu," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her mamalishe with cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Saudatu

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Saudatu. She is a widow and has one child, aged 35. She has three additional dependents, who live with her for assistance in schooling.  

In 2003, Saudatu established her patent drugs business. She began her business just to be self-reliant. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,350,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Saudatu requires a loan in order to buy paracetamol, ibuprofen and cough syrups. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase the stock and expand the business. In the future, Saudatu plans to expand to other areas of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen has successfully built her business of general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more stock of grains, sugar, flour, biscuits and juices. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grains, sugar, flour, biscuits and juices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement, wood, and bricks in order to renovate his old house.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
This is Alice. She is single. 

In 2007, Alice established her beer, stout, soft drink and malt business. She began her business because she wants to live a better life. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are adults. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,374,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Alice has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan in order to buy beer, stout and malt. She hopes that this loan will improve on the business and generate more income. 

In the future, Alice plans to start running a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for beer, stout and malt.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma is a 34-year-old married woman. For the past seven years, she has been selling spices, which are used in food for taste, with the support of her husband who is also shown in the picture. She purchases spices in bulk from wholesales market and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become famous by providing good quality spices in her locality and earns enough to have a decent life. She is a responsible mother of two children and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. For this reason, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity.

loans.name: Dolan

texts.en: Dolan is a 56-year-old married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has one calf; she sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is very motivated to provide her family with good food, health and clothing. It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for her milk sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make a bulk purchase of fish for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
This is Sunday. He is single and has no children.   

In 2009, Sunday established his car decorations and accessories business. He began his business because he wants to be independent and to meet his personal needs. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,105,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Sunday has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now he requires a new loan in order to buy additional car horns, seat covers, wipers and car tape. He hopes that this loan will increase his purchasing power, thereby letting him have more stock. 

In the future, Sunday plans to open another outlet at the western part of Freetown. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for car horns, seat covers, wipers and car tape.

loans.name: Dipika

texts.en:
Dipika, aged 22, is a married woman. She has a little daughter who is too young for school. Dipika has a secondary education. She lives with her husband and daughter in their own mud-made house at Bengkandi in Jalpaiguri district. Her husband, Uttam, is a green grocer in the local market. He has no consistent income, so it is hardly possible for him to maintain a family with his income.

Dipika is hardworking and optimistic. She is very motivated to provide her family a beautiful life with good food and clothing. Thus she started up a business selling cow milk to her locality with the support of her husband. She cares for one dairy cow and sells the milk to her locality to assist her husband financially to run the family. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. She wants to purchase another dairy cow to start a milk products (curd, butter, cottage cheese, etc.) business. She has earned the good will of her neighbors as she sells good milk. She hopes this will make her successful with her new venture.

With determination she turned to BJS (Kiva 's partner). She is requesting a loan to purchase a cow.  She dreams to see her daughter established in life. She also aspires to construct a concrete-made house for her family.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk and milk products selling business.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She has been operating a general store for the past five years. She offers various goods for daily use.  She works hard to provide a good quality of life to her family members. Through her business she is able to meet her household expenses. 

Asiya requested her third loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock such as oil, rice, spices, biscuits, beverages, etc. at lower rates. She would consistently be able to meet the increasing demand of her customers. Asiya wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with the expenses of her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as oil, rice, spices, biscuits, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Lazaro Mariano

texts.es:
Lazaro es un padre de familia dedicado, casado con una maravillosa mujer con quien formó una familia con un hijo, viven todos en Huarmey. Desde muy joven ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia. Por iniciativa propia comenzó su negocio de venta de frutas y espárragos, con esos ingresos pudo sacar adelante a su familia y brindarle una educación de calidad a su hijo, por quien hoy se siente orgulloso ya que se ha convertido en una persona de bien.
Lazaro está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar más frutas y espárragos para poder surtir su negocio y así vender más, de esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán y seguirá luchando para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Lazaro is a dedicated family guy, married to a wonderful woman with whom he has child, and they live in Huarmey. Since an early age, he had to fight to support his family. 

By his own initiative, he started a business selling fruits and asparagus. With those incomes he was able to get them ahead and give his child a quality education. He is proud of his son since he has become a person of good. 

Lazaro is thankful to Kiva lenders since with the support they have given him, he’ll be able to buy more fruit and asparagus to supply his business and sell more. This way his incomes will improve and he will keep fighting to make his business grow.

loans.use: to buy asparagus and fruits for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 46 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Rosario tiene su restaurante en el cual vende desayunos, almuersos y cenas, desde hace 15 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio; ella solicita préstamo para invertir en Activo fijo; compra de mesas y sillas para su restaurante, dado que su clientela a aumentado y no tiene suficientes mesas y sillas para poder atenderlos, esto le generará un mejor trato a sus clientes y por consecuente en corto plazo le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y al mismo tiempo podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario is 46 years old, is a live-in partner, her children are under her care and lives at her own house in the rural area of the district Oyotun, in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, located in the northern shore of Peru.

Rosario has a restaurant in which she has sold breakfasts, lunches and dinners for the last 15 years. It is located at her place of residence. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in her fixed asset; buy tables and chairs for her restaurant, since the amount of customer has been increasing and she doesn’t have enough chairs or tables to serve them.

 With this she will improve her customer’s service and in a short term will allow her to increase her incomes, improve her profits and at the same time, improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Maximino

texts.es:
Maximo tiene 62 años, es casado, vive en casa propia junto a esposa y 02 hijos, su familia es unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Maximo se dedica al servicio mototaxi y su esposa a la venta de verduras en el exterior del mercado. Además, el titular ofrece servicios en la empresa agroindustrial Cayalti. Él solicita inversión en compra de verduras para negocio de ventas de las mismas a cargo de su esposa; ya que con ello podrán hacer crecer dicho negocio, ofrecer una mejor atención a los clientes y así poder generar mayores ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maximo is 62 years old, is married and lives in his own house together with his wife and two children in a close family. They live in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and raising livestock, located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru.

Maximo works driving a motorcycle taxi and his wife sells vegetables outside the market. He also provides his services to the Cayalti Agra-industrial company. He is requesting a loan to buy vegetables for their resale by his wife. By doing this he can make this business grow, offering better service to the clients and being able to generate greater revenues to enjoy a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ravshanjon

texts.ru:
Равшанчон молодой жизнерадостный парень в возрасте 28 лет. Он еще не женат. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Равшанчон живёт со своими родителями в сельской местности. Он помогает своим родителям финансово и по хозяйству. Они у него уже пожилые. Равшанчон не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. 

Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание, Равшанчон занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Мама продаёт молоко, полученное от скота  своим соседям.  Сейчас Равшанчон хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Равшанчон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ravshanjon is a cheerful, young man of 28. He is not yet married. He turned to Arvand at first, when he learned that there is the possibility to receive financial support. Ravshanjon lives with his parents in a rural area. He helps his parents financially and around the farm. They are already elderly. Ravshanjon does not have a higher education, since there was not a possibility to study in a university because of the financial challenges of the family.

In order to have a steady income to buy food, Ravshanjon engages in his own business. He fattens and sells cattle. His mama sells the milk received from the cattle to their neighbors. Now Ravshanjon wants to increase the quantity of livestock in order to expand his business. Therefore he turned to Arvand and wants to get a loan to purchase cattle. Ravshanjon very much hopes for a positive results and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past 6 years she has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics and different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 40000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. 

Rahila expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married businesswoman with 2 children. She resides in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. Charity volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education at the local secondary school to improve the wellbeing of students. In addition, Charity runs her own business. She buys cattle then sells them to local abattoirs. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.
  
With the Kiva loan, Charity will purchase more cows to increase her production. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own farm to raise her cattle. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to increase her production.

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa, 28, is a resident of Subhaspally, Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. Married to Maklesar, a worker in a tea garden, she is a mother of two daughters; both are in primary classes. Though she is a housewife, she works hard, together with her husband, to meet the family's daily basic needs and for the education of her daughters.

As her husband has an inconsistent and meager income, it is hardly possible for them to maintain the household expenses. So, Champa wants to start tea leaves cultivation. In the area where they live, most of the people are engaged in tea cultivation, as the climate is appropriate for this. Her husband has experience in this field. So, she hopes her business will be a lucrative one.

To start her business, she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (tea saplings). She is positive that her hard work will yield more harvest and income for her to strengthen the financial condition of her family.

Champa dreams to give her family a better life and provide her daughter the best education possible. She is very much thankful to her generous lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to start tea leaves cultivation.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal San José está conformada por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y  un hombre, personas responsables con ganas de salir adelante, son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos de la familia.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de superación la coordinadora es  Irma y  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, frijoles, detergentes, jugos, galletas, cigarros, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir la pulpería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. San José agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan, a personas de escasos recursos, para tener medios de trabajo y ganarse el pan de cada día dignamente.
texts.en:
The San José communal bank is made up of eight members, seven women and a man, responsible people motivated to get ahead. They are from El Sauce in the northern part of the region.

They are known to be hardworking and responsible, with a desire for self-improvement. They were unfortunately not able to get schooling due to lack of financial resources. They had to start working from an early age in order to help with household expenses.

Irma is the group coordinator, thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead. She earns a living keeping a pulpería, which is a small store that sells groceries in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, juices, cookies, cigarettes, matches. She works about twelve hours per day offering her products.

The loan is to invest in working capital and supply the pulpería in order to improve her earnings in the not so distant future.

San José is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support offered to people of scarce resources so that they may have the means to work and make a living respectably.

loans.use: to supply her small grocery store.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is 71 years old and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is widowed and has five children.  To earn a living, Charlita has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 6000 each month doing this type of work. Charlita has requested a loan to buy ingredients for her snack vending business.
Charlita has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Charlita would like to expand her business and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Sugeily Flor

texts.es:
Sugeily es una joven emprendedora de 20 años, soltera, trabaja como empleada en una empresa de su ciudad natal, Lima - San Juan de Lurigancho. El buen desempeño que tiene en el trabajo es el resultado de todo las ganas que le pone, a su responsabilidad y entusiasmo con el que día a día labora. Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, por ellos diariamente se esfuerza cada vez más para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Sugeily está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una computadora, que va a utilizarlo tanto para su trabajo como para su uso personal. De esta manera seguirá luchando por le bienestar de su familia, para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Sugeily is a young entrepreneur of 20 years old, single, and works at a company of her birth town, Lima- San Juan de Lurigancho. Her good performance at work is the result of all her effort, responsibility and enthusiasm with which she works every day.

Her biggest motivation in life is her family. Every day she makes a bigger effort to provide them a better quality of life. 

Sugeily is grateful to Kiva lenders since with their support she will be able to buy a computer that she will use for her work and personal use. In this way, she will keep fighting for her family’s well being in order to give them a better future.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Dersin

texts.es:
Dersin es una persona trabajadora de 34 años, soltero y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Su familia es la mayor motivación que tiene para salir adelante, desde muy joven ha apoyado a sus padres en la chacra, cultivando diversos cultivos. Con un poco de esfuerzo pudo adquirir un pequeño terreno y se dedica exclusivamente al cultivo de caco, con estos ingresos está ayudando a sus padres a salir adelante.
Dersin está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar insumos como abono orgánico y cubrir los gastos de mantenimiento de sus plantaciones. De esta manera su producción mejorará así como sus ingresos y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dersin is a hard-working person who is 34 years old, single, and lives in San Martin with his family. In fact, his family is his major motivation to advance. From an early age, he helped his parents on the farm, cultivating diverse crops. With some extra effort, Deersin acquired a small piece of land and he is now exclusively dedicated to cultivating cacao. With this income, he is helping his parents to get ahead.

Dersin is grateful to Kiva investors for the help they offer so that he can purchase inputs such as organic manure and cover the costs of maintaining his plantings. In this manner, Dersin's production will improve as well as his income and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy inputs for his cacao (chocolate) plantings.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and the mother of three children, and all of whom go to school.  She has no additional family members.  She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She sells used clothes at the market and has been in this business for 10 years. She work six days a week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the fluctuating prices of used clothes.  

Sylivia has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.  She is aspires to own a fully stocked stall of both used and new clothing.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Oimniso

texts.ru:
Оимнисо жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 41 лет. Она замужем и имеет 4-х детей. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сама Оимнисо живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Муж Оимнисо находится в России на заработках. У него также нет высшего образования.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Оимнисо занимается своим делом. Она швея. Шьет на заказ женские платья, свадебные наряды. От данного дела она получает хороший доход. Сейчас Оимнисо хочет приобрести новую швейную машину и материалы для шитья. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку материалов и швейной машинки. Оимнисо очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Oimniso is a cheerful and hardworking woman of 41. She is married and has four children. She turned to Arvand at first when she learned that there was the possibility to get financial support. Oimniso lives with her family in the countryside. She does not have a higher education since there was not a possibility to go to college because of financial challenges in the family. Oimniso's husband is working abroad in Russia. He also does not have a higher education.

In order to have income to buy food, Oimniso is engaged in her own business. She is a seamstress. She takes orders to sew women's dresses and wedding gowns. From this work she receives a good income. Now Oimniso wants to purchase a new sewing machine and materials for sewing. Therefore, she applied to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase materials and a sewing machine. Oimniso very much hopes for a positive results and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 43-year-old married woman. For the past five years, she has been selling spices which are used for cooking. She purchases spices in bulk from a wholesale market and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become famous by providing good quality spices in her area and earns enough to provide a decent life. She is a responsible mother of 7 children and needs to earn more to cover the daily expenditures of her family members. 

For this reason she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in bulk.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.  She wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in bulk.

loans.name: Tana Lisbeth

texts.es:
La joven Tana 27 años de edad, vive con su hijo  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 4 años al negocio de venta de comida como desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, también vende Golosinas, como tajaditas, tacos, tortillas con quesillo enchiladas y otros, sus clientes son los vecinos de su comunidad.
Tana vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras,  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y que lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Tana está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como frescos, verduras, quesillo, carnes, pollo,  arroz, etc. con esta inversión espera que su negocio mejore y a su vez le genere los ingresos necesarios para mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Tana uno de su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Tana is 27 years old and lives with her son in her own house. For the past four years she has been working in her business of selling meals like breakfast, lunch and dinner. She also sells snacks like fried plantains, tacos, tortillas with cheese, enchiladas, etc. Her clients are neighbors from her community.

Tana lives in a village in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with desire to get ahead and fight every day to improve her quality of living. Tana is requesting a loan to buy products like fruit drinks, vegetables, cheese, meat, chicken, rice, etc. With this investment she hopes to improve her business and at the same time generate the revenues needed to increase her income and also her quality of living. She is a new client who has the desire to work with Prisma. Tana has a dream of having a good business and expanding her clientele and at the same time improving her future along with her family.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2014.

loans.use: to buy fruit drinks, vegetables, cheese, meats, chicken, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su padre, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. La población en esta comunidad se dedica principalmente al comercio y/o agricultura.

Karina se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos de belleza, desde hace más de 2 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio y a pedido de clientes también va hasta los domicilios de sus clientes que se lo soliciten. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de mercaderia como perfumes, collares, etc. para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock y asi poder atender a todos los gustos y pedidos de sus clientes; de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Karina is 35 years old, single and lives with her father at their own house in a big community of the rural area of Cayalti. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. 

This community is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, in the northern shore of Peru. The people in this community work mainly in commerce and/or agriculture.

For more than 2 years, Karina has sold beauty products in a business located at her place of residence. Depending on her clients’ requests, she also goes to their homes. 

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, like perfumes, necklaces, etc. to increase and diversify her stock and in this way, satisfy all of her clients needs, make her business grow and obtain more incomes to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, like perfumes and necklaces.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy, age 53, is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has been married for thirty-three years to a fisherman, and they have five children. Daisy joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her fish vending business. Daisy and her husband  planned to buy a boat engine for fishing so that they would have a bigger catch and more fish to sell. Recently, Daisy has asked for Php14,000 financial assistance from PMPC to pay for a second-hand boat engine for fishing. Daisy wishes nothing more than to continue putting bread on the table for their family.

loans.use: to pay for a second hand boat engine unit for fishing

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 63 years old and widowed with three children. She lives in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela, Philippines. For the past 20 years, Alicia has been a rice farmer. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

Alicia is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to save money to use for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is fifty-two years old, married and a hardworking mother. She lives in Plaridel-Katipa in the Philippines. Emma's husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years. Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. Last September 10, 2008 both Emma and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to receive loans because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings. Emma has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fish for resale. She hopes that with Paglaum’s help and with patience and diligence of her husband, she will be a successful vendor someday, with a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina is 71 years old and lives in Upper Centro Tudela,Philippines. She is single without children. 

Wilhelmina was a retired teacher and earns approximately PHP 10000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional housing materials.

Wilhelmina has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future, Wilhelmina hopes to save more and to provide her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials

loans.name: Florgie

texts.en:
Florgie is married with four children. Florgie is 44 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan,Tudela, Philippines.

Florgie is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers.

Florgie has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Florgie hopes to save more in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Fulgencio Manuel

texts.es:
Fulgencio un hombre soltero de 45 años de edad dedicado a la vida del campo, oficio que aprendió de sus padres y con el  cual se ha independizado buscando sus propios ingresos y una historia que contarle a la familia que quiere formar. 
Tiene sus cultivos de plátano, y al estar solo se le ha dificultado mucho su profesión pues tiene que hacer de vendedor, tiene que cuidarlos, darle asistencia, y aunque suene redundante buscar siempre quien se los compre pues de esto vive y con esto ha logrado sacar su vida adelante. 
Solicita un crédito para dar asistencia a sus cultivos, comprara abonos, riegos, e insumos para desparasitar sus plantaciones. 
Con el crédito podrá tener una cosecha con buena calidad y cantidad pues las plagas y el clima no afectara ya que con estas compras estará preparado.

Sueña con tener una familia una mujer con quien envejecer y unos hijos con quienes compartir sus historias, sus vivencias y su amor.
texts.en:
Fulgencio is a single man of 45 years of age who has dedicated his life to farming. He learnt this profession from his parents and with this he was able to become financially independent and make an income and a life story to recount to the family that he hopes to create.

Fulgencio grows banana crops. Being alone means that his profession is all the more harder because he has to be a vendor as well as look after his crops and maintain them. Even though it may sound redundant, Fulgencio always has to look for buyers since he lives from this job and it has allowed him to move ahead in his life.

Fulgencio is applying for a loan to maintain his crops by buying fertiliser, irrigation and supplies to rid his plantation of parasites. With this loan he will be able to have an abundant harvest of good quality. Neither pests nor weather will affect his crops because with these purchases he will be prepared.

Fulgencio dreams of having a family: a wife to grow old with and children with whom he can share his life story, his experiences and his love.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain his crops including fertiliser, irrigation, fungicides and pesticides to have a more abundant harvest

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is married with five school age children.  They live at their own house that has electricity, but not piped water.  His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

He has operated a agricultural business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of disease outbreak and pests affecting his crops.

With the Kes 10,000 loan he is requesting, Justus wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on his farm. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for irrigation on his farm.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 54, is divorced and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a stall selling soft drinks in front of her house. 

She started this business four years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of soft drinks to stock her stall and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for selling from her stall

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Esther has been volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to local students. In addition, Esther rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family. 

With the Kiva loan, Esther will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. Her desire is to create employment in her community, as well.

loans.use: To increase her stock and open her own shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Vimbai

texts.en:
Vimbai is 30 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Buhera District, Zimbabwe.  

Vimbai has been volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools.  In addition, Vimbai rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for two years now and it has enabled her to support her family. 
 
With the Kiva loan, Vimbai will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store.  This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies

loans.name: Saydahmad

texts.ru:
Саидахмад жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 25 лет. Он женат и имеет 3-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Саидахмад живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье.
