Жена Саидахмада также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание Саидахмад занимается своим бизнесом. Он работает водителем пассажирской маршрутки. Саидахмад имеет собственный автомобиль.  От данного дела он получает хороший доход.  Сейчас Саидахмад приобрести новый автомобиль для развозки пассажиров. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку нового автомобиля. Саидахмад очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Saydahmad is a cheerful and hardworking man of 25. He is married and has three children. He turned to Arvand at first when he learned that there was a possibility to get financial support. Saydahmad lives with his family in the countryside. He does not have a higher education, since there was no possibility to go to college because of the financial challenges in the family. Saydahmad's wife also does not have an education and is a homemaker. She engages in domestic work and raising the children.

In order to have income for buying food, Saydahmad has his own business. He works as a driver of a passenger shuttle. Saydahmad has his own car. From this work, he receives a good income. Now Saydahmad is buying a new car for transporting passengers. Therefore, he applied to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase a new automobile. Saydahmad very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima has successfully built up her business selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 8th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more animals. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Adibai

texts.ru: Адибаи молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 20 лет. Она проживает в южном районе Кубадиён вместе с родителями мужа и еще одной невесткой. Муж Адибаи уехал на заработки в Россию. У них пока нет детей. Адибаи преприимчивая женщина и сейчас при поддержки семьи мужа начинает новый бизнес. Она собирается заняться куплей и продажей миндаля. Этот бизнес в районе прибыльный. Чтобы закупить партию миндаля для продажи, Адибаи берет кредит. Она нуждается в финансовой поддержке, так как собственных средств недостаточно. Адибаи надеется на Вас.
texts.en: Adibai is a young, married woman of 20. She lives in the southern region of Kubadiyon together with her husband's parents and one other sister-in-law. Adibai's husband left to work abroad in Russia. They have no children. Adibai is an adventurous woman and now in order to support her husband's family she has started a new business. She intends to engage in buying and selling almonds. This business is profitable in the region. In order to purchase a portion of almonds for resale, Adibai is taking a loan. She needs financial support since her own means are insufficient.

loans.use: to buy and resell almonds in order to have a source of income

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella is 39 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married and has two children. Shella has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional housing materials for renovation and to buy raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
Shella has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Shella hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials for renovation and to buy raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 52 years old and lives with her parents. She works managing her food vending business in Danao, Plaridel, Philippines. Emma has mastered her business since she has chosen to be single in her life. She does well providing for the needs of her old parents. Emma has local customers and also accepts big orders to earn added income.

Emma is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase meat and spices for her food vending business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married with four children. She is fifty-five years old and lives in Dinas Sinacaban, the Philippines.

Anita is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for twenty years. She has requested a loan to pay for twenty coconut trees.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Anita hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: pay for twenty coconut trees

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор родилась в 1966 году. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Гулрухсор более 3 лет занимается купле продажей женской одежды. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Гулрухсор недавно купила новый дом. Они с мужем накопили деньги и купили этот дом. Теперь надо оформлять все документы дома, однако они не имеют денег. Гулрухсор обратилась за займом в сумме 1000 долларов США для того чтобы оформлять документы дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulruhsor was born in 1966. She is married and has one child. For more than three years, Gulruhsor has been engaged in buying and selling women's clothing. Her husband is a labor migrant in the Russian Federation. Gulruhsor recently purchase a new home. She and her husband saved money and bought this home. Now she needs to make official all the documents of the home, but they do not have the money. Gulruhsor applied for a loan of US $1,000 in order to complete the official home documents.

loans.use: To make official the documents of her new house

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim works hard to support her family. She is 39 years of age and married. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has four children. Most of her income is spent on the well-being of her children.

Shamim is in her 7th loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR. This loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine, spools of thread and other stitching materials. She wants to earn more income and spend it on her children’s health and education.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, spools of thread and other stitching materials.

loans.name: Anila

texts.en: Anila is a 45 year-old married woman doing a business of flour grinding with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo.  They very well know the techniques of grinding flour finely and have gained seven years of experience in this field.   They have become famous for providing fine quality flour and earn enough to support the needs of her family members. In order to purchase a new grinding machine, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will help her to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately will help in generating more cash for them.  Anila wishes to spend part of profits on the betterment of her three children.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is married and blessed with three children. She sends all of them to school with the earnings she generates from operating her beauty salon. Rubina has operated the salon for three years. In such hard times, she is a woman with a firm belief in empowering women through beautification and full-filling their beauty-related dreams.

Rubina is requesting a loan to buy a stock of beauty equipment such as mascara, bleach creams, and makeup kits. She will use her portion of the group loan to help improve her beauty parlor and thus help improve the standard of living for her family. Rubina hopes to continue to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and equipment

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en: Hoa is thirty-three years old and lives with his sons and wife. For the past forteen years, he has been running a butcher shop to earn an income to support his family. He is the Group Leader of a three-member loan group based in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, he is seated on the right wearing a dark blue t-shirt. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Hoa is requesting a loan to purchase better quality meat to sell from his shop. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional ones. He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to buy meat to sel

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
Imelda tiene 29 años, su estado civil es conviviente, conocida en el medio por la elaboracion y venta de ladrillos de cemento. Ella vive en casa propia con su conyuge y 02 hijos de 04 y 12 años respectivamente, quienes estudian en colegio nacional de la zona. Imelda cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales; vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Saqa, el cual es muy conocido por sus famosos dulces tipicos, y es habitada por personas morenas, respetuosas, que se dedicadan al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Imelda se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de ladrillos de cemento, desde hace más de 02 años, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores tales como patos, cuyes, conejos, pollos, entre otros; Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de material para elaboración de ladrillos de cemento, lo que le generará mayores ventas e ingresos a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Imelda is 29 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She is known in the area for making and selling cinder blocks. She lives in her own house with her spouse and her two children, aged 4 and 12 years old who study in the National College of their area. Imelda has good personal and business references. She lives in a community located in the district of Saqa, which is famous for it's traditional candy and is inhabited by dark-skinned, respectful people who work in commerce, agriculture and raising cattle. This district is located in the Province of Chiclayo. Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru.

Imelda has been working making and selling cinder blocks for the past two years. She also works raising and selling small animals like ducks, guinea pigs, rabbits, chickens, amongst others. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of material to make cinder blocks which will generate more sales and income for her family.

loans.use: to buy material to make cinder blocks.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 62 years old and married. She lives in Cebulin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs that are owned by her neighbors. The piglet’s owners share in the profit; after a sale the money is divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in the agreement. Erma has decided to raise her own pigs to earn more income and she obtained a loan through Pauglam PC to purchase her original piglet and swine feed.

Erma is requesting 6,000PHP loan to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow to benefit her family and supplement her husband’s income. In the future, Erma wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Maria Teodolinda

texts.es:
María Teodolinda tiene 32 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Teodolinda se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, gallinas, pollos, patos, cuyes, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; ella piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
María Teodolinda is 32 years old, married and has one son. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Oyotún district in the province of Chiclayo, located in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

María Teodolinda raises and sells animals such as roosters, hens, chickens, ducks, guinea pigs, etc. She has over 10 years of experience in this business which she runs from her home.

María Teodolinda is applying for a loan to purchase more animals. This loan will help her to have a larger variety of animals and increased productivity, which will have a great impact on her business.  María Teodolinda believes that by acquiring more animals she will be able to cater to the different tastes and needs of the customers in her area.

loans.use: to have a larger variety of animals and increased productivity, which will have a great impact on her business

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is 38 and married with a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past 20 years, Chau has earned an income running a garment-making business. She and her husband also sell electrical products from a small store in front of their house. 

Chau is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of electrical products and equipment to sell. She hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: too buy a variety of electrical products and equipment to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and has no additional family members. For the past five years, Susan has sold fried cassava, sweet potatoes, and pancakes at the market. She works seven days a week and her major business challenges include thieves and transportation. Susan lives in her own house and the family does not have electricity or running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Susan is requesting a 500,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, cassava, sweet potatoes, baking flour, and cooking oil. In the future, she aspires to expand her business so as to serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, cassava, flour, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella lives in Kampala,Uganda. She is a married mother of four children, all of whom  go to school.  She has no additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation. She aspires to buy a plot of land and build a house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity but has has piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 32 years old and married. She has a daughter and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is running a beauty salon. She started this business six years ago.

She intends to use her loan to repair her salon for a better appearance, and to buy some more cosmetic products to sell at her salon.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions. She wants to save money for her child's education.

loans.use: to repair her beauty salon and to buy comestic products to sell

loans.name: Neciforo

texts.en:
Neciforo is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. Neciforo hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by his loan of PHP 38,000. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing with good repayment record. 

Neciforo has been given priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. He is thankful that all his financing needs on his retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: for house renovation

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
La señora Santos Estela de 44 años de edad es soltera  vive con sus cinco hijos tres de ellos trabajan y contribuyen a los gastos de su  hogar, vive en un barrio de Nacaome en la zona sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 11 años a la venta de abarrotería, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. 
Doña Santos Estela solicita el préstamo para la compra de abarrotaría como ser: refrescos, churros, granos básicos, detergentes, jabón carnes, leña seca, aceite, aguas, etc.  Con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y a su vez espera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia,  uno de sus  sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto  del 2014
texts.en:
Santos Estela is 44 years old, single and lives with her five children. Three of them work and contribute to the household expenses. They live in a neighborhood of Nacaome in the Southern part of Honduras. For 11 years she has sold groceries. Her business is located in her house. Estela is requesting a loan to buy groceries like soft drinks, churros, basic grains, detergents, soap, meat, dried wood, oil, water, etc. With the help of this loan she hopes to improve her revenues and at the same time improve her quality of living and that of her family. One of her dreams is to improve her house and business.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, churros, basic grains, detergents, soap, meat, dried wood, oil, water, etc for her business.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 42, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income selling construction materials. They started their business twelve years ago. 

Lien is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of construction materials to sell at her store to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy and sell construction materials.

loans.name: Tambudzai

texts.en:
Tambudzai is a 30-year-old businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Tambudzai has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer, teaching communication and leadership skills to young students. In addition, Tambudzai rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for two years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  
With the Kiva loan, Tambudzai will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 22 years old and lives in the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. She is an active volunteer, serving as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school and assisting the elderly in her community. Additionally, Juliet operates a poultry business from her home. She started the business from the small savings she accumulated after being trained as a Camfed Learner Guide. Juliet has been able to support herself and her family because of her business’s success. With the loan from Kiva, Juliet will be able to grow her business by increasing the number of broiler chickens she raises in each batch. She also intends to buy vaccines for the broilers. The profits will help in the upkeep of her family.

loans.use: to increase the number of broiler chickens she raises and to buy vaccines.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh, 44, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Hanh and her husband earn money through their business selling meals. She started this business for five years. 

Hanh would  like to get a loan to buy more chairs and tables for her stall and a larger stock of rice to make food for selling. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and tables for her stall and to buy rice to make food for selling

loans.name: Dao's Group

texts.en: Dao is 44 years old and lives with her children and her husband who is an electrician. For the past 20 years Dao has been running a beauty salon from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a six-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is the first of the second row from left. Each of the other group members is requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Dao is requesting a loan to purchase hairdressing tools for her salon. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing tools for her salon.

loans.name: Loc

texts.en:
Loc works selling soft drinks and masks. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Loc is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks and masks to sell from her stall. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. Loc will use her loan to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and masks to sell

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Trang started her clothing sales business four years ago. Now she is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better and more beautiful clothes to meet her customers' needs. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the inventory turnover of her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with five children together. He has a retail shop which he has been running for four years, and right now his monthly income is KES 40,000.

Robert will be using this loan to buy more goods to sell. These include sugar, flour, rice, bread and milk. He will use the anticipated profits to further increase his stock of goods.

This is Robert's second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. In the future, he hopes to have a stable business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong works selling coffee and beverages from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to earn a higher income to support her family. 

Dong is requesting a loan to buy more coffee and beverages to sell. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. Dong hopes her loan will help increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and coffee

loans.name: Dhanabala

texts.en:
Dhanabala is a happy mother of three sons. She is a 49-year-old woman and hails from Maynaguri. Her husband, 54-year-old Sakalu, and her three sons all work as laborers on a daily wages basis. Their sons are also deprived of education due to their poor financial resources. They live in their own mud-made house at the village of Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district.

As the earnings of Dhanabala's husband and sons are inconsistent, she earns a living for the family, rearing cattle. Dhanabala wants her family to be happy and to have a good life. She has been involved in animal husbandry for a long time. Every morning, she milks the cows and then sells their milk at the market, where the demand is high. She derives a good income from this activity.

She now wants to increase her cattle to earn more to cope with the growing price of essential commodities, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. This is the reason why she has turned to Kiva's partner BJS for financial assistance. She is hoping to get some support to receive the money needed to keep her small business going. She will use the loan to buy a cow.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is a wife, mother, volunteer, and businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. She is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who mentors secondary school students. Additionally, over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 25 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. Selina started the business in 2013 because she wanted to be financially independent and she saw that it was very profitable in her community. Selina would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Razan Group

texts.en:
Ghada is a 53-year-old married mother with two children. She is the featured borrower for the Razan group. Ghada got along with her other group members to request this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. Group members are working hard to develop their businesses and improve their living standards at the same time. 

For the past 21 years, Ghada has been selling clothing to help her husband cover their family’s needs and living expenses. She will use her portion of the group loan to purchase new fashionable clothing for the upcoming autumn season. Ghada will use her loan to expand her business and increase her merchandise to provide better living conditions for her family. With respect to the other group members, Mariam is a 33-year-old married mother of one child who works selling lingerie and Manal is a 33-year-old married mother of three children who works as a tutor from her house. Mariam will use her loan to purchase lingerie and Manal will use her loan to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for both her students and children. 

In this photo, Ghada is the lady standing at the center of the picture, while Mariam is the lady standing at the left, and Manal is the lady standing at the right side of the picture.

loans.use: to purchase new fashionable clothing for the upcoming autumn season

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Noemí de 57 años de edad, es madre soltera,  tiene casa propia y tiene una hija que depende de ella, vive con su hija  en la comunidad  de Nacaome,  valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de costura también vende  tamales y sándwich.
Doña Ruth Noemí es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, tijeras, etc. para elaborar uniformes como pantalones, vestidos, blusas, etc. Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, es un cliente que solicita préstamo numero 5.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Ruth Noemí is 57 years old and is a single mother. She has her own house and a daughter who is dependent on her. She lives with her daughter in the community of Nacaome, a valley in the south of Honduras. For 20 years, she has worked in the sewing business and also sells tamales and sandwiches.

Ruth Naomi is a hardworking and enterprising woman with a desire to succeed. She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, scissors etc in order to make uniforms such as trousers, dresses and blouses. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her income and therefore her quality of life. She is a client requesting her fifth loan.

Her dream is to improve her business and her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, scissors etc for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and married. She and her husband are blessed with four children. Rose runs a cereals business in Kisumu town where she sells beans, rice, sorghum, wheat and other products. 

Rose is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her child. She will use her savings to buy more stock of cereals to sell. This will be her third loan from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, Rose hopes to be successful and be able to provide good education for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is 32 years old and married. She has two children between seven and twelve years old, and both go to school. 

She has been selling milk and Fanta for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soft drinks for sale. The profit from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Paul Yonel

texts.es:
Paul es un padre de familia luchador con una maravillosa esposa y dos hijos por quienes lucha día a día para brindarles un mejor futuro. Por iniciativa propia trabaja como Operario de construcción, con los ingresos que percibe está sacando adelante a su familia, cree que le va bien por su esfuerzo constante, su tenacidad, responsabilidad y porque es muy emprendedor.
Paul está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una juego de dormitorio para su hijo de 5 meses de nacido, de esta manera estará más seguro  y evitarán accidentes. Con ello estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá trabajando para más adelante poder brindarles una educación superior a sus hijos y verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos.
texts.en: Paul is a hardworking family man with a wonderful wife and two children, and he strives daily to provide them with a better future.  On his own initiative, he works as a construction worker and he makes ends meet for his family with the income he earns.  He believes that it is going well because of his constant effort, tenacity, and responsibility, and because he is very enterprising. Paul is grateful for the Kiva loans because, with the support they have provided, he will be able to purchase a bedroom set for his five month old son.  In this way, he will be safe and they will prevent accidents.  This will improve his family’s quality of life and he will keep working and later be able to provide his children with a college education and see them become successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase a bedroom set for his small son.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is requesting a new loan to buy garments to sell and to repair her house. Van's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell and to repair her house.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en: Trinh is requesting a new loan to buy food for her food stall and to buy some furniture for her house. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food for her food stall and furnishings for her house.

loans.name: Shamiso

texts.en:
Shamiso is a 24-year-old single mother from the Gokwe South District in Zimbabwe. Shamiso runs a small grocery store at the local business centre where she sells rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil and snacks to her community. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Shamiso volunteers each week as a teacher of life skills at the local secondary school. 

Shamiso plans to use the Kiva loan to build her own shop so she no longer has to spend her profits on rent. Shamiso hopes to be able to have a stable income so that she can support her family.

loans.use: To build her own shop and restock rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, chemicals, and seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wide and stylish variety of clothes in large quantities to sell.

loans.name: Shamimu

texts.en:
Shamimu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who both go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Shamimu sells chips at the market on retail basis and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, cabbage and a bag of irish potatoes. She generates additional income from selling soft drinks. She sells on retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. 

Shamimu decided to join MCDT SACCO because of their good customer care. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. She aspires to own a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, irish potatoes and cabbage

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 22-year-old businesswoman. She is married with one child and lives in Gokwe South District in Zimbabwe. Caroline rents a small stall where she sells dresses, shirts, blouses, trousers and different types of shoes. She volunteers in her community as a Camfed Learner Guide; she provides life and leadership skills to secondary school students. 

Caroline’s goal is to expand her business with the Kiva loan. More specifically, she will purchase clothing in bulk. With the profits, Caroline will be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To expand her business through purchasing clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is 26 years old, married and the father of one child. He earns a monthly income of KES 8,000 by selling clothing, and is requesting this loan to buy more items to sell to his customers. Among other things, he would like to buy shirts, t-shirts, blouses and trousers. He will use the income he expects to earn to pay school fees for his child. This is his first loan he has requested from VisionFund Kenya. His goals are to grow his business and provide a good education to his child.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret lives in Muzarabani, Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide. She assists young students to overcome life and education obstacles.  Additionally, Margret runs her own shop where she sells groceries such as sugar, cooking oil, flour, and soap. Through hard work and dedication, she dreams of seeing her small business expand. Margret is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase groceries in bulk and add new products to her shop. With the additional profits, Margret hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk and add new products to her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Olman Onan

texts.es:
El joven Olman de 22  años de  edad, vive en su casa  junto con su esposa y su hijo,  se dedica desde hace 1 año al negocio de venta de abarrotería como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pollo, papel higiénico, sardinas, agua en bolsa, etc. sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y también personas de otras comunidades cercanas ofrece buena atención y buenos productos.
Olman es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio de materia prima como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, frescos, huevos,  sardinas, bolsas plásticas, churros, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita tener los ingresos suficientes para salir adelante con su esposa e hijo.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras  - Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Olman is 22 years old and lives in his house with his wife and child. For the past year he has been working in his business selling groceries like rice, sugar, beans, lard, eggs, chicken. toilet paper, sardines, water in bags, etc. His clients are all neighbors and also people from neighboring communities. He offers them good service and good products.

Olman is an enterprising man with the desire to get ahead and struggles from day to day improving his quality of living. He is requesting a loan to stock his store with raw materials like rice, beans, sugar, fruit drinks, eggs, sardines, plastic bags, churros, etc. He hopes that this investment will allow him sufficient revenues to get head with his wife and child. His dream is to expand his business to improve their quality of living.

San Lorenzo, Valle Department, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, fruit drinks, eggs, sardines, plastic bags, churros, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Zaliya

texts.en: Zaliya is married with seven children and four of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She sells six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She is aspiring of building rental houses. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of good customer care and timely loans. She has her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru:
Абдусаттор трудолюбивый и жизнерадостный парень  в возрасте 23 лет. Он пока что не женат и не имеет детей. Он обратился в Арванд не впервые. Вот уже несколько лет он является клиентом Арванд. Сам Абдусаттор живёт с родителями в городе. У него неполное высшее образование. Абдусаттор учится заочно и одновременно работает. 

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Абдусаттор занимается своим бизнесом. У него имеется Интернет кафе. Там он работает после учёбы. Посетители приходят к нему, чтоб провести время за компьютером, а еще Абдусаттор чинит компьютеры.  От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Сейчас Абдусаттор нужно срочно оплатить обучение этого года в Университете. Но у него сейчас не имеется достаточной суммы денежных средств. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит, чтобы заплатить за свою учебу и продолжить учебу в Университете.  Абдусаттор очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdusattor is a hardworking and happy 23-year-old young man. He is still single and does not have children. This is not his first time coming to Arvand. He has been an Arvand client for several years. Abdusattor lives with his parents in a city. He has an incomplete higher education. Abdusattor studies part-time and works concurrently.

Abdusattor is involved in his own business to have an income for living. He has an Internet cafe. He works there after his studies. Customers come to him to use computers, and Abdusattor also fixes computers. He earns a good income from this business. Now Abdusattor needs to urgently pay for his annual university tuition, but does not currently have a sufficient amount of money. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to pay for his tuition and continue his university studies. Abdusattor really hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Abdulqader

texts.en:
Abdulqader is a 24-year-old single young man living in Zarqa, Jordan, with his family that consists of five members. His father is a retired man. 

He is a university student majoring in Finance, and he is in his second year. Abdulqader is seeking to work in his study field after getting his bachelor's, but he currently doesn’t have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 33 years old and lives in Buhera District, Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide and volunteers at the local secondary school. In addition, Gloria tailors clothing to earn money. She makes and sells products such as shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for four years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  With the Kiva loan, Gloria will purchase more material, buy two sewing machines, and sewing thread to increase her supplies. Gloria’s hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more material, two sewing machines and sewing thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to buy a van to reduce transport costs. She rents a house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 37 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with four children. She is a dairy cattle farmer and has been in the farming business for three years now. Her spouse also provides additional income for supporting the family.

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she will be using this loan to buy seedlings for planting napier grass for her dairy cattle. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business by buying more dairy cows. Caroline's future hopes and dreams are to grow her business, make more income, and to be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings to plant napier grass for her dairy cattle.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. 

She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. They sell their catch to the market in their place. This is the source of their income. 

Several years ago, a super typhoon hit their place and ruined most of the houses and businesses. Adela's fishing boat was not spared.

Currently, Adela is asking for a loan to buy materials for her fishing boat like plywood, nails, wood, and new engine, fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. With this, she and her husband will be able to go back to fishing. Adela hopes to expand their fishing business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for their fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 32-year-old, businesswoman from Buhera District in Zimbabwe. Janet volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches secondary school students leadership and communication skills. Additionally, Janet operates a salon at the local business center. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Janet will expand her salon and open a barber shop so that she can create employment. She will purchase barber scissors, chemicals for the salon, dryers, and rollers to increase her supplies. This will bring stability to Janet’s business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs and also improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies like scissors, chemicals, dryers and rollers.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a businesswoman living in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. Doreen has recently been volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. To support herself she has been selling clothes over the last year. With the requested Kiva loan, Doreen will make bulk purchases of clothes to boost her sales and profits. With additional profits, she hopes to create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is 31 years old, and she is married with two children ages 3 and 6, and both of them go school. She has been a wholesaler of clothes for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas.   

She also generates additional income from selling local brew. She sells seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and high transport costs. She aspires to own a fully stocked stall selling different products. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages, milk, and cell phone recharge cards to sell.

loans.name: Jean Eugene

texts.en: Jean Eugene is 52 years old, married. and the father of six children who range in age from 14 to 18. Four of them attend school. For the last 20 years, he has earned a living by selling beer. Jean Eugene is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer to sell to his customers. He will use the additional income he expects to earn to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Davlatoy

texts.ru:
Давлатой жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 41 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3-их детей. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сама Давлатой живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Она имеет высшее образование. Но из-за того что нужно было воспитывать троих детей она не работает по специальности и является домохозяйкой. Находится всегда рядом со своими детьми и заботится о них. Муж Давлатой тоже имеет высшее образования. Он работает бухгалтером.

Чтобы помогать своему мужу в обеспечении семьи всем необходимым, Давлатой работает на дому. Она швея. Шьет на заказ женские платья. От данного дела она получает хороший доход. Сейчас Давлатой хочет приобрести новую швейную машину и материалы для шитья. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку материалов и швейной машинки. Давлатой очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Davlatoy is a cheerful and hardworking woman, aged 41. She is married and has three children. She first applied for a loan with Arvand when she found out it was possible to receive financial assistance. She and her family live in a rural area. She has a college degree, but since she needs to raise her three children she is a homemaker and does not work in her area of specialization. She is always close by her children and takes care of them. Her husband also has a college degree and is an accountant.

In order to help her husband in providing for the family, Davlatoy works from home as a seamstress, taking orders for women's dresses. She earns a good income from these activities. She wants to buy a new sewing machine and sewing materials, so she applied for a loan with Arvand. She hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase provisions such as sugar and milk to sell

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda. She sells Irish potatoes at the market, which she has been doing for six years. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Aminah requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO for 300,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy bags of Irish potatoes. Her goal is to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include utilities and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase bags of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop for her studies at the university

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима занимается своим любимым делом шитьем и зарабатывает этим на жизнь. Данной деятельностью она занимается у себя дома в районе Рудаки более 5 лет. Рахима научилась ремеслу швеи у своей сестры и она в свою очередь научила этому делу своих дочерей. У 43-летней Рахимы двое дочерей и двое сыновей. К сожалению муж бросил ее, и она сама обеспечивает семью. Дочери усердно помогают матери с ее заказами, так как швейный бизнес единственный источник дохода семьи. Сейчас Рахима хотела бы расширить свое дело и поэтому обратилась за кредитом. Она на сумму кредита планирует купить модернизированную швейную машинку. Поддержите Рахиму!
texts.en: Rahima is involved in her favorite business of sewing and earns a living with it. She has been involved in this business at home in the Rudaki district for over 5 years. Rahima learned the seamstress profession from her sister and then taught it to her daughters. 43-year-old Rahima has two daughters and two sons. Unfortunately, her husband left her, and she solely provides for her family. Her daughters diligently help her with her orders because the sewing business is the only source of income for the family. Now Rahima wants to expand her business and requested this loan. She plans to purchase a current sewing machine with the loan amount. Please support Rahima!

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a 21-year-old married woman and responsible mother of a toddler. She is living with her husband and son at Vivekananda Pally in Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. Her husband, 36-year-old Shankar, is a mason by profession. 

Jayanti has been involved in sewing for the last six years. She decided to share her husband’s burden, earn, and be independent. So, she took training in tailoring, and from then on she has been engaged in tailoring. Now, she has taken an important role in the family's income and all the responsibility for her daughter. She currently has one sewing machine, which she uses to stitch salwar suits, blouses, petticoats, etc. 

Now, she is asking for loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will use her loan to purchase a new sewing machine that will help her to run her business smoothly and stitch more clothing, as the old one has been damaged and is old-fashioned.

She says the gain from her business will help her to strengthen her family financially and help her to be more independent. She hopes to be able to train some girls in her village and hire them for help by buying more sewing machines and growing her business, creating a living for other girls in the village.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for this financial help.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette, 41,  is married with 5 children aged between 5 and 19, and all of them go to school. She has been selling books for 7 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more books to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more books to sell.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is a 27-year-old woman who is a housewife. She hails from Dhupguri. She is married to Pulen, who is 44 years old and engaged in agricultural activities. Together they are rearing two children (one son and one daughter). They are students of grade 7 and 5. They live in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.

Their principal occupation is the cultivation of paddy rice, and they depend upon this to generate income to cover their family’s various basic necessities. The product is sold in their region. Her husband is involved in the daily care and protection of the product; she is also involved in the afternoon, after she finishes household work.

Nilima is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) in order to purchase supplies such as fertilizer and compost and good-quality paddy seeds. She will use them to provide necessary care for her agribusiness.

Her goals are to be able to increase her production so that each season it will be greater than it had been in the previous one, and to improve her income day by day. She hopes she will be able to build up capital in order to work in her own way, and support her children as much as possible so that they might get ahead and be prosperous people. She dreams to upgrade their house with the profit generated.

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to cultivate paddy rice.

loans.name: Nyame Aye Ewie Group

texts.en: Isaac is 50 years old and he is a member of the Nyame Aye Ewie Group. Isaac is happily married with 5 children. His two youngest children are still in school. Isaac lives with his family in Abura Koforidua in the Central Region of Ghana. Isaac has been a farmer for 17 years. He grows both coconuts and oranges. He also owns a small provisions shop to supplement his income. However, his main source of income remains his farm. Isaac and his fellow group members belong to local registered farming association that is very dynamic with strong leadership. His association also gets regular capacity building support from GIZ Germany, Ghana Office and the Ministry of Agriculture (MOFA Ghana). The association has obtained a contractual agreement with a local company that buys their crops. Isaac now only needs to focus on maximizing his profit. He plans to re-invest the profit from his farm for future expansion. Isaac finds it costly to maintain his farms since it is very difficult to finance the cost alone. He has to hire laborers for work to weed the farm and harvest the crops. He also has to pay for labourers to transport the oranges to sale centres. Without this help, Isaac crops would remain in the farm and he would lose income. Isaac hopes to make enough profit on his farms so that he can also see his two younger children through high school and tertiary education. A micro-loan of 1,800 GHC is requested by Isaac to undertake the farm maintenance to improve his household income. Isaac is thankful to all micro-lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to weed the farm and harvest the crops

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru:
Жительница района Рудаки - Сарвиноз, в возрасте 31 года, начинает новый бизнес. У нее есть талант шитья и она хотела бы использовать его на профессиональном поприще и таким образом начать зарабатывать. Однако у Сарвиноз нету швейной машинки. Поэтому она берет кредит, чтобы купить компьютерную швейную машинку, а также необходимые ткани для шитья. Она планирует шить национальные женские платья и будет сдавать их на продажу знакомому продавцу рынка, с которым она уже заранее договорилась.  
У Сарвиноз высшее образование и ранее она работала учительницей. Сейчас она работает кредитным офицером в микрокредитной организации. Ее муж тоже учитель. У них двое детей. Сарвиноз хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Новый бизнес поможет ей в этом.
texts.en:
Sarvinoz, a 31-year-old resident of the Rudaki district, is starting a new business. She has a talent in sewing and wants to use it professionally, and start earning a living with it; however, Sarvinoz does not have a sewing machine. This is why she is requesting this loan to purchase a computerized sewing machine and also necessary fabrics for sewing. She is planning to sew women's national dresses and sell them to a market seller she knows and already reached an agreement with. 

Sarvinoz has a higher education and previously worked as a teacher. Now she works as a loan officer at a microfinance organization. Her husband is also a teacher. They have two children. Sarvinoz wants to improve her family's financial situation, and the new business will help her with it.

loans.use: to purchase a computerized sewing machine and also necessary fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Gabriela Yomalia

texts.es: Gabriela es una jovencita de 20 años de edad, vive con sus padres que se dedican a jornal, de igual manera Gabriela trabaja al jornal en la agricultura, también se dedica a ofrecer  LEUDINE  que son productos de salud,  belleza, cuidado de la piel y del cabello, entre otros, comenta que si le va bien en su negocio ya que se esfuerza hacer buenas ventas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos LEUDINE para variar su mercadería,  lo que Gabriela aspira es mejorar su negocio y de  esta manera reunir algo de dinero para entrar a estudiar que por falta de recursos económicos no ha podido hacerlo.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 20-year old young woman who lives with her parents. They work as day laborers on farms as does Gabriela. She also sells Leudine health and beauty products (for skin and hair care etc.)

Gabriela says that her business is doing well since she works hard selling her products. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy a wider variety of Leudine products. Her hope for the future is to improve her business so she can save enough money to take further education courses, something she hasn’t been able to afford.

loans.use: to buy Leudine health and beauty products

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 16 years, and two of them go to school. She sells items in a shop and has been working in this business for the past 8 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more sugar and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 32 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She sells beer, which she has been doing for three years. 

Eugenie requested a loan, which she will use to buy more Misting and Primus (beers) to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more beer to sell

loans.name: Henry Paul

texts.es:
Henry Paul tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes, vive con sus hijos y su conyugue. Henry Paul vive en el distrito de Pucará, dicho distrito es mediano, y está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que son realizadas en este distrito son el comercio y la agricultura.

Henry Paul se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual trabaja, realiza servicio de transporte público en el distrito de Pucará y caseríos cercanos, además se dedica al comercio de frutas como por ejemplo piñas, naranjas, chirimoyas, etc., cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro.

Henry Paul es natural de Pucará, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, solvencia moral y económica, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y asi asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo; de esta forma seguir generando ingresos para poder adquirir una utilidad acéptale para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Henry Paul, 36, is in a common-law relationship.  He has two dependent children, and lives with his partner and children.  He lives in Pucará, a medium-sized district, located in Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region of Peru’s northern sierra.  The main activities carried out in this region are business and farming.

Henry Paul offers transportation services.  He works using his own motorcycle taxi, providing public transportation services in the Pucará district and nearby villages.  In addition, he is engaged in selling fruits such as pineapples, oranges, and cherimoyas.  He has over five years’ experience in this trade.  

Henry Paul is a native of Pucará, and has many good personal references for his moral character and financial solvency.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in the maintenance of his motorcycle taxi and thus, ensure proper operation of his business tool.  In this way, he can continue generating income be able to obtain an acceptable profit so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his motorcycle taxi and thus, ensure proper operation of his business tool.

loans.name: Tatiana Judith

texts.es:
Tatiana Judith tiene 22 años de edad, ella reside en el caserío La Toma, en el distrito de Buenos Aires, desde hace más de 20 años, vive en casa propia, junto a su hija menor de edad. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, además del comercio. Dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Tatiana Judith es al alquiler de mototaxi, asi como también a la crianza y venta de aves de corral(patos, chivos, conejos, pollos, entre otros), y venta de ropa por pedido, esta actividad el la realiza hace más de 3 años, cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, con capacidad de pago. El destino del crédito será para equipamiento de su mototaxi y capital de trabajo en compra de ropa; lo que le generará mayres ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tatiana Judith is 22 years old, and she has lived in the village of La Toma, in the district of Buenos Aires, for more than 20 years. She lives in her own house, together with her younger sister. Life in the community is calm, and they work in agriculture and livestock in addition to trade. This district is located in the province of Morropón, in the Piura region on the North coast of Perú.

Tatiana Judith works for hire with her motorcycle taxi, and also raises and sells fowl and animals (ducks, goats, rabbits and chickens, among others). In addition, she sells clothing on request, which she has been doing for more than 3 years. She relies on a loyal clientele in the area, who are able to pay. The loan will be used for equipment for her motorcycle taxi and to buy clothes to sell; this will generate for her higher earnings, a better income, and from this an improvement in her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her motorcycle taxi, and to have capital to buy clothing.

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.en:
Hadidja is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children, aged between 11 and 3 years.  All of them go to school. 

She sells shoes and has been selling for the past 14 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 39 years old. He has been selling beer for eight years. With the loan, he would like to buy more crates of beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Fulti

texts.en:
Fulti is a very modest and hardworking woman who hails from Dhupguri. She is only 22 years old and attended school until grade 9, as her parents did not have the resources needed to support her further education. Now she is married and the mother of a young daughter. She lives with her family at West Shalbari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Fulti's husband, 29-year-old Gopal, is engaged in an agribusiness. His business is and has been, for a number of generations, the planting and growing of paddy rice. His father taught him this trade, as it is the principal source of income for their family and the majority of families in the area they live in. The land is located 30 minutes away from their house. When the product is ready, it is sold to the buyers or rice dealers. Fulti helps her husband in sowing seeds and harvesting crops.

Her plan is to improve the condition of their business so that during the next harvest, all the work done will be evident and the maintenance that is done for each harvest increases. As a mother of a little daughter, she will support her child so that she can study and progress the best. She also wants to increase the profit from her business.

She is presently requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy fertilizer and good-quality paddy seeds amongst others to fertilize her paddy crops and take care of them. So, she hopes to be supported. Her dream is to upgrade their present mud house to a concrete-made house.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Agim

texts.en:
Agim is 46 years old and the father of 2 children, aged 13 and 15 years old. 

He has his own business selling food and other products in a shop that is in his home. He has a lot of customers from his village and has been doing this for a long time. In addition, he is also involved in agriculture, owning a cow for milk and milk products for family consumption and sale. 

At this time he is in need of a loan in order to purchase materials such as food, beverages and other products. This loan will allow him to continue his business that he runs with his wife. 

He wants to thank all of the lenders for this support.

loans.use: to purchase food, beverages and other products.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
El señor Lorenzo de 62  años de  edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de leña  sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y también personas del comercio de San Lorenzo,  el ofrece buena atención y buenos productos.
Don Lorenzo lleva el producto a la casa de sus clientes para poder venderlos, es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Lorenzo está solicitando el préstamo para compra de cuatro llantas nuevas para mejorar su vehículo y también comprar algunos fletes de leña y mantenerlos en reserva y luego venderlos a un mejor precio.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -  Agosto de 2014.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 62 years old and he lives in his own home with his wife and their children. He has been working for the past ten years selling firewood to customers who are his neighbors as well as people who trade from San Lorenzo. 

Lorenzo offers good care and good products and he brings the product to his customers' homes to be able to sell it to them. He is an entrepreneurial man with hopes of improving his quality of life. 

Lorenzo is requesting the loan to buy four tires to improve his vehicle as well as to buy some loads of firewood to keep in stock and later sell them for a better price. His dream is to grow his business to improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -  August 2014.

loans.use: to buy four tires and firewood for his business.

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is a 25-year-old married woman living in the area of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal, with her family of four members: her husband, two sons and one daughter. Her sons go to school and are in grade 3 and 1, and daughter is too young for school. She is an uneducated but active and energetic woman. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health expenses. They live in their mud house in Dhupguri.

Her husband, 25-year-old Bablu, has been running a small grocery store at the corner of his house for many years. He purchases a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. This store is the only source of income for the family, but this is not enough to pay her children's school fees and the family's other expenses. He wants to enhance his business by adding more stock in the grocery shop. He hopes that adding different variety of products will improve his earnings and his family's status.

So Anjana is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). The loan will be used to buy stock of grocery items for her husband's business in order to keep their customers and increase earnings. In near future, she wants to get ahead with the business for more income to provide better education to her children.

Anjana is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support offered to people of limited resources like them.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks for her husband's  grocery store.

loans.name: Manoyara

texts.en:
Manoyara is a 23-year-old married active and hardworking woman, hailing from Dhupguri.  She is married to Md. Kadduch and together they are raising two children (one daughter and one son). She is living with her family in their own house in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. 

Manoyara's husband runs a business making quilts and selling to their neighbors, friends and relatives. He is the sole breadwinner of his family, and his income is not fixed and is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. In order to provide her family with a good living standard, Manoyara decided to work on raising cows and selling milk to earn enough money for her children. Her children are her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide them with a better future.  With her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10 and 15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. She sells milk to her neighbors who are her main clients.

Now Manoyara is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via BJS to purchase an additional dairy cow.  An additional cow will provide her with a lot of practical benefits.  She will be able to produce more milk, increase her sales volume and sell the cow dung to generate additional income.  She aims to save the returns to send her children to a better school.
 
In the future, she wants to enlarge her business. She aspires to build a concrete-made house for them with the profit and she is thankful for her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel  de  31 años  de edad, vive con su esposa y sus  tres hijos en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 09  años al negocio de venta de camarón,  en su negocio ubicado en  el mercado de Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras, en su negocio el vende camarón cocinado, camarón frescos y sardinas.
Don Miguel es un joven trabajador y emprendedor con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de 04 quintales de camarón,  para cocinarlo  con el apoyo del financiamiento desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento, es su segundo crédito que solicita y está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener casa propia.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Miguel is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and his 3 kids in his residence. He has been selling shrimp for the last 9 years. His business is located in the Nacaome Market, it is a valley in the South of Honduras. He sells cooked shrimp, fresh shrimp, and sardines.

Miguel is a young hard-working and enterprising man. He wishes to thrive. He is requesting the loan to buy 4 quintals of shrimp to cook. With this funding, he wishes to cover the need for further funding. 

This is the second loan he requests. He is very happy to keep working with Prisma. His dream is to own a house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August, 2014.

loans.use: to buy 4 quintals of shrimp for his business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is 51 years old and he lives in Bayabo. His wife and three children are doing well. Bernardo is still in the farming business, and he was able to buy some calves with the previous loan. Bernardo managed to expand his farming activities with his previous loan and, right now, his monthly income is PHP 10,000 to PHP 15,000. 

He has applied for this loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to use in his business. 

In the future, Bernardo hopes to be an established farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to use in his business.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Miguela works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Miguela is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Miguela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Blessed Hands That Gives Group

texts.en:
Paul is a member of Blessed Hands that Gives Group. He turns 61 this year and is happily married, with six children. His eldest child is working, while the rest are still in school. 

Paul lives with his family in Enyinabrim, which is in the central region of Ghana. Paul grows limes, oranges, and an oil palm plantation on 50 acres. However, his current source of income is from the limes and oranges. His crops are growing well and though his oil palms are young, they will mature and be ready for harvest in two years' time. He also has a future plan of increasing the oil palm plantation. 

Paul is also the chairman of a local farmers’ association and is highly respected in the farming community and by development partners because of his dedicated leadership. He has undergone several trainings from GIZ Germany (Ghana office) and the Ministry of Agriculture (MOFA Ghana). 

Paul finds it difficult to pay for the financial costs of maintaining his farms. He needs micro loan support to be able to maintain his farm to maximize crop yield. He needs GHS 3,700 to pay for the cost of weeding the farm and harvesting the crops. Without the financial support, his efforts cannot be rewarded. The income from the farming activities will also help Paul pay for the school fees of his children. 

Paul thanks all his micro-lenders for their generous assistance.

loans.use: to weed the farm and harvest the crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy manure, urea, fertilizer etc. for her coffee plants

loans.name: Najima

texts.en:
Najima hails from Dhupguri, which is a remote region in the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. She is 26 years old, married and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters).  Her husband Alam, 27 years old, is a farmer by profession. Najima resides with her family in West Magurmari, Jalpaiguri district.

Najima always takes her children's upbringing as challenging, so that is why she is doing everything in her power to provide a good foundation for her children and to be able to secure their future. She has an elementary education so she is determined to provide her children with a higher education. Najima's husband has been farming for many years. Over the years, he has gained much experience and now he has decided to cultivate paddy besides vegetables. He has not been making good profits because of the poor farming implements.

That is why Najima is seeking a loan from BJS to buy farm implements for her husband's agribusiness. Through the loan, he will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve the crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Najima and her husband are thankful for BJS and Kiva

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies in order to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Anidaso Kuw Group

texts.en: Margaret a is a group leader of Anidaso Kuw Group of Assin Wawase in the Central Region of Ghana. She is 62 years old and married with eight children. Margaret's three elder children are married and on their own and the remaining five are currently attending school. Margaret is a petty trader and palm oil producer. She sells at the local market and to a soap-producing company currently based in Assin Fosu. Margaret's main priority now is to secure a loan to purchase a clean cook stove (a.k.a. Elsa Stove) that uses waste products such as Virgin Pellet (palm kernel shells) as fuel. Palm kernel shells are waste products from her oil processing. Margaret will use this byproduct from her oil processing and will not incur any fuel costs when she adopts the use of the Elsa Stove. As a result, she will save some money for her household. This stove is the product of a research project supported by the African, Caribbean and Pacific (ACP) Group of States Science and Technology Programme and the European Union (EU)to eliminate both indoor and outdoor air pollution and to reduce deforestation. The adoption and the use of the stove means the end to cutting down of trees for firewood and charcoal for cooking and heating water in their community.
