loans.use: to pay for additional alkaline filters needed for water distribution business.

loans.name: Jomildred

texts.en:
Jomildred, 25, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines.  She is married to Danny, and a mother to their two children.  Their first child is in Elementary school.  She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to support her child’s schooling.
 
Jomildred operates a motorized tricycle and owns a small variety store.  Her husband drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers.  In the Philippines, especially in the provinces  like Palawan, motorized tricycle is a common means of transportation, Jeepneys and buses are limited.  Very few people own a vehicle.  The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, friend’s homes, and to other destinations within their community.  They even transport from one town to the other.  She earns a minimum of 700 PHP a day.

To help continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to use for repairs and maintenance of her tricycle and also to add some grocery items for her small variety store.  She is positive that this will boost her income as motorized tricycle transportation and a variety store is really needed.

Jomildred dreams of being successful in her business so she can provide her children with the best education possible and give them a better future.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs, maintenance of her tricycle unit and add some grocery items for her small variety store.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Mercy successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Mercy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell sea cucumber business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more sea cucumber to sell for her business.

Nida has been in this business for six years. Nida earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sea cucumber to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her business.

Jessica successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Jessica's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza works hard to support her family. Monaliza is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, and cooking oil.

Monaliza has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Monaliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is 48 years old; she is mother of five children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a fodder shop for the last eight years. He manages his household necessities from his own fodder shop as well, and some of his relatives like to purchase fodder for their animals from his store. He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relationships with them. His fodder shop is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to his good relationships his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Sakina has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stock of fodder for his shop. Sakina hopes that her son will utilize the loan in positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demand of her family. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fodder for her son's business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old, married with three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Josephine has been in this business for five years. In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Esnath

texts.en:
Esnath lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at schools in her community teaching students life skills. 

Over the past 5 months, she has expanded her poultry business to its current capacity,  producing about 60 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She began her business because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. 

Esnath would  like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase broiler chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and drugs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fifteen modern sewing machines for quicker and better-quality products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 19-year-old business woman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Priscilla works hard as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to secondary school students. In addition, Priscilla rents a table at the local flea market to sell bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has run this business for 4 months and it has enabled her to support her family.  

Priscilla will use the loan to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her inventory. Priscilla hopes to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs and improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts .

loans.name: Norman

texts.en: Norman is from Ozamiz City. He is a 50-year-old father of two children. He operates a balut (fertilized duck eggs) vending business in his community to make a living. His wife helps him in their business to gain additional income for the family. Recently, Norman took out a new loan to buy more fertilized duck eggs for sale. He is thankful for this loan that helped his business as well as improving his family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy more fertilized duck eggs for sale

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en: Charlene is from the village of Banadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three adult children. Charlene owns and operates a business providing rooms for rent to college students. Charlene has been engaged in her business for many years and has been able to sustain it. After she joined GDMPC, she gained access to financial services and helped to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aside from her boarding house business, she also has had a general store selling grocery goods in their village to earn more income. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a married business owner with one daughter.  

He has 3 greenhouses and has grown flowers for 6 years.  The whole family is involved in this business.  Ivan also works in a factory as a loader. He is active and hardworking.

Ivan asks for 25,000 UAH to buy firewood, a greenhouse cover, and seeds. This loan will help to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy firewood, a greenhouse cover, and seeds.

loans.name: Aljane

texts.en: Aljane owns and operates a banana farm to earn a living. She has been helping her husband for over six years and earns well for the family. The farm is doing well and is helping to pay the education costs of her two children. With her generated revenue, her previous loan used for replanting costs has been successfully repaid. To restore farm nutrients, she took out a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house, support her children's future education and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, reside en el caserío Tierras Duras del virrey casa propia desde hace más de 20 años junto a su familia. La actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de animales menores, tales como patos, conejos, cuyes, pollos, entre otros.

La actividad a la que se dedica Santos es a la venta de ganado patos, conejos, cuyes, pollos, entre otros, esta actividad la realiza hace más de 5 años contando con la experiencia en el negocio la cual le ayuda a invertir con calidad su capital de trabajo. Sus ventas las realiza en su domicilio y alrededores. Santos cuenta con muy buenas referencias crediticias y en la zona donde vive. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado y asi poder diversificar su stock y posterior engorde, el dinero restante será para unificar deudas de Caja Piura, y trabajar exclusivamente con Edpyme alternativa.
texts.en:
Santos, 57, is in a common-law marriage, and she has lived in the Tierras Duras del Virrey settlement with her family for more than 20 years.  She works buying and selling small animals such as ducks, rabbits, guinea pigs, chickens, and other animals.

Santos has been selling ducks, rabbits, guinea pigs, chickens and other small livestock for more than 5 years.  Her experience in the business helps her to invest her working capital well.  She makes her sales from her home and in the surrounding area.  

Santos has very good credit references in the area where she lives.  She will use this loan to buy a greater quantity of livestock so that she can diversify her stock and latter fatten them.  She will use the remainder of the loan to consolidate debts that she has from  Caja Piura so that she will be working exclusively with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and both of her children are in school.

Marites has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marites has been in this business for sixteen years.  In the future, Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Precy

texts.en:
Maria Precy works hard to support her family. Maria Precy is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials needed like a net and ice box.

Maria Precy has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing like a net and ice box.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 49-year-old widow with five children, one in school. Elena works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and canned goods.

Elena has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and canned goods

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 37 años de edad, por falta de recursos económicos logro estudiar solo hasta 5° grado de educación básica, está acompañada desde hace 20 años y tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando. 

Carmen es comerciante pequeño, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a vender tortillas y tiene un puesto a 500 metros de su casa en donde además vende fruta. Desde muy joven sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar, por lo que todos los días realiza dicha actividad.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar maíz, lo principal que necesita para su venta de tortillas, tiene una oportunidad de cómpralo barato y quiere aprovechar la oferta.


Carmen espera que Dios le preste vida para que con su trabajo logre que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, también quiere que aprendan a trabajar y prepararlos así como la prepararon sus padres.
texts.en:
Carmen, 37 years old, managed to attend school only until the 5th grade due to the lack of economic resources. She has had a partner for 20 years and has two children who are in school.

Carmen is a small business woman. She has been selling tortillas for 12 years and has a small stall 500 meters from her house where she also sells fruit. When she was very young her parents taught her to work, consequently she has been running her business every day.

She will use the loan to purchase corn, the principal ingredient she needs to sell tortillas. She has the opportunity to buy it cheaply and wants to take advantage of the offer.

Carmen hopes that God lets her live so that she can work and help her children to finish their studies. She also wants them to learn to work and to prepare them just as her parents prepared her.

loans.use: to purchase corn.

loans.name: God's Way Group

texts.en:
John is a member of God's Way group. He is 68 this year and happily married with 5 children. All of his children are working now, except his youngest who is presently attending a teacher's training college. His other 4 children are also farmers. John lives with his wife in Abura Enyinabrim in the Central Region of Ghana.

John has been a farmer for 28 years. His farm is at two different locations. The first site is where he has an orange, cocoa and oil palm plantation, and on the second farm he grows cassava, plantain and cocoyam (taro, a root crop). He earns his entire living from his farming activities. John and the rest of his group members belong to the locally registered Citrus Farmers Association that coordinates the marketing and capacity building of their members.

John is finding it difficult to obtain a micro loan locally to finance the cost of maintaining his farms. He used to maintain the farms alone during his prime years; however, as he ages, his physical strength cannot cope with the maintenance demands. John is asking for a micro-loan of GHS 1,000 to hire labourers to harvest his crops and transport them to the sales centre. The loan will help John to increase his profit significantly, and his profits will far exceed the loan he needs to invest in his farms now. John thanks all his micro-lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to hire labourers to harvest the crops

loans.name: Naranzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Naranzul, 24 years old, lives with her parents and brother in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Since 2013, she has been working as a bookkeeper at a coat making company. She has studied economics at university, and due to her academic excellence, she was able to secure a job just after graduation. Her mother and father run a tailoring workshop. Her younger brother goes to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to buy a sofa, a drawer, and a dining table in order to improve her family's living conditions, as the previous items became outdated.

loans.use: to buy a sofa, a drawer, and a dining table

loans.name: Jhonny Luis

texts.es: Jhonny es un joven de 23 años de edad. Estudia la carrera de Mantenimiento y maquinaria pesada en un instituto de prestigio en la cual le va bien. Actualmente vive con sus tíos, pues ellos son los que lo apoyan. También labora en una ferrería, esto le genera ingresos para poder cubrir con gran parte de los gastos de sus estudios. El crédito que solicitó es para la compra de llaves y barómetro, lo cual será su herramienta de trabajo en sus prácticas de estudio. Terminar la carrera y ser un profesional competitivo es su meta. Jhonny agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 23 years old. He is studying heavy equipment maintenance at a renowned institute where he is doing well.

Nowadays he is living with his aunt and uncle who support him. He also works at a hardware store and this generates the income to cover a large part of his educational expenses.

He requested the loan to buy wrenches and a barometer, work tools necessary for his school practice.

His goal is to complete his course of studies and become a competitive professional. Jhonny is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy wrenches and a barometer, work tools needed for his school practice.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with five children. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamiz City with her family. She has been operating their own farm for over twelve years and has been able to sustain it. Her previous loan, which was used for farming, was successfully repaid. She is now taking a new loan to purchase planting materials and fertilizer.

In the future, Gloria wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase planting materials and fertilizer

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta has been operating a general store for many years to earn a living. She earns well from this and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She attended various training offered by the cooperative, and it helped her to improve her ability to engage in business. She had save for the future education of her children, and was determined to save more for it. Her husband had a car shop and was earning well, too. 

To offer more goods to her costumers, she took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

She was determined to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Katrina Marie

texts.en:
Katrina Marie is single and is working in a private school as a teacher. She had four siblings and she helped them go to school. Her parents are farmers and are earning enough for their daily needs. Two of her brothers were in college and she helped to support their financial needs in order to continue studying. 

She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay the school tuition fee of her brother. 

In the future, she wants to work in the government school and hopes to see her siblings successful, too.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee of her brother

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old and married with seven children, one in school. Gloria works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, and coffee.

Gloria has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. Juliet is married, and has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Juliet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 46 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional stock of household goods to sell, like noodles, soap, coffee, etc.

Lilia has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future Lilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of household goods to sell, like noodles, soap, coffee, etc

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old and married with three children who are all in school. Janet works very hard to provide for her family.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like noodles, eggs, chips, and spices..

Janet has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like noodles, eggs, chips, and spices.

loans.name: Rezel

texts.en:
Rezel is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a e-loading (mobile phone prepaid load) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional prepaid load to sell to customers.

Rezel successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Rezel's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid (mobile phone) load to sell.

loans.name: Dilma

texts.en:
Dilma is 43 years old and married, with three children, two of whom are in school. Dilma works very hard to provide for them.

Dilma runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, and chips.

Dilma has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, and chips.

loans.name: Sancha

texts.en: Sancha, 44 years old, is a businesswoman and her husband is in agriculture. She is the mother of two children. She has a kiosk in her house and is requesting a loan of (USD) $1,000 to improve her kiosk. She is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants used to buy needed items to keep in her kiosk such as perfume, medicine, candies, cigarettes, soft drinks, slippers and other things to sell. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of (USD) $100. With a loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to improve her business and to make her business bigger in the future. She also cultivates animals at her house like cows, pigs, chickens and goats.

loans.use: To buy perfume, medicine, candies, soft drinks, cigarettes, slippers and other things to sell.

loans.name: Rolisita

texts.en: Rolisita is 22, single and lives with her family. She is now working in a private institution to make a living. Her mother is selling grocery goods in their home to earn an income for the family. The business has been running for over 10 years. She plans to improve the business for her mother to earn more income. To help, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She helped her mother to look over the business on weekends and during her off time. She wants to expand and improve the business as well as the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a 40-year-old married man from the town of Ajuy, Iloilo, in the Philippines.  For five years now, he has been engaged in fishing and in a hog raising businesses.  

Judy would like to improve his livelihood after the challenge that he encountered during the typhoon Haiyan devastation.  He is asking for a loan to buy materials for fish cages such as fishing net, plastic screen, and wood.  Judy hopes that with the help of the loan, he will be on his way to business recovery.

loans.use: to buy materials for fish cages such as fishing net, plastic screen, and wood.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela is a married woman from Ajuy, Iloilo. Her husband is a fisherman, and she helps him in any way, to earn a living. She makes sure that what he needs is ready for him, to be more productive, so they can support their three children. Their children are aged one to nine years. The destruction brought in their area by the past typhoon, Haiyan, affects their livelihood, especially their fishing tools, like their fish cage and their boat. Shiela is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and a motor. Once these are available, their business could do well and be more successful. Her income will keep her children in school and provide healthy meals for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a motor

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en:
Engracia is 64 years old and married, with eight children.

Engracia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, cooking oil, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, and beer.

Engracia has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Engracia aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, cooking oil, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, and beer.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a 28-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He sells general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap to mention but a few. He also started up a motorcycle transport business to provide for his family's needs and supplement his income. His dream is to build a permanent house, although he is challenged by inadequate capital. Geofrey will use the loan to buy general merchandise like soap, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like soap, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Siphathisiwe

texts.en:
Siphathisiwe is a 24-year-old businesswoman and mother of one child. She lives in Umguza District in Zimbabwe. Siphathisiwe sells hair products like relaxers, hair sprays, and hair extensions. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers at the local secondary school.

With the loan that she is requesting form Kiva, Siphathisiwe intends to purchase hair extensions, sprays, and relaxers in bulk from wholesalers. With the additional profits, Siphathisiwe would like to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more hair extensions, sprays, and relaxers to sell

loans.name: Azzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Azzaya, 34 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a janitor at the police department since 2004. Her husband repairs damaged cars at home. Their two children go to secondary school. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years. So, Azzaya is requesting a loan of MNT 3,000,000 to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam for house renovation, so that her family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air. 

In the profile picture, the borrower is with her husband and son since her daughter has gone to her school.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Ropina

texts.en: Ropina is a 29-year-old, married woman with four children. She has a small elei printing business to earn an income within her village. She has been doing this for three years. Ropina has requested a loan to buy stencils, wooden carved designs, brushes, rollers, fabric paint and material. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Ropina hopes to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy stencils, wooden carved designs, brushes, rollers, fabric paint and material

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
This is Julie. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful for the maintenance of her boarding house which she also operates for business purposes. Likewise, her income from the loan assisted with her everyday expenditures at home.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional Vita Plus products like multivitamins, coffee, lotion and other products. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and expenditures. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julie hopes to expand her business and open branches to other provinces. She also wants to help others if given bigger opportunities. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy Vita Plus products like food supplements and vitamins needed in her business.

loans.name: Renzo

texts.es:
Renzo es un joven soltero y emprendedor de 18 años, y vive en Irazola junto a su familia. Actualmente ayuda a sus padres en la chacra con sus cultivos para poder sacar adelante a sus hermanos. También por iniciativa propia aprendió a manejar y brinda servicios de transporte con una mototaxi, cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador, luchador y sobre todo porque quiere brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
Renzo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi, de esta manera no tendrá inconvenientes al momentos de trasladar a sus pasajeros. Con los ingresos que obtenga estará mejorando su calidad de vida y así seguirá luchando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Renzo, age 18, is single, and he is an enterprising young man.  He lives in Irazola with his family.  He currently helps his parents with their crops on the farm in order to be able to get his siblings ahead.

Also, on his own initiative, he learned to drive and provide transportation services with a mototaxi.  He believes that it is going well for him because he is very responsible, hard-working, and tenacious.  Above all, he wants to provide his family with a better future.

Renzo is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  With the support that they have provided, he will be able to provide maintenance and make repairs to his mototaxi.  This way he will not have difficulties when he is transporting his passengers.

With the income he gets he will be improving his quality of life.  This way he will continue struggling for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to provide maintenance and make repairs to his mototaxi.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a widow and she has settled down to earn her living at Gango, Ozamiz City. She has been running a general store for over ten years and is earning well for her needs. She is able to generate savings from her income and the business is doing well. To offer more goods to sell, she joined GDMPC and has taken out a new loan to purchase more grocery goods. She is determined to save more for her future needs.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Melencia

texts.en:
Melencia has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own direct selling business for years, and she earns well from this. She has had to work hard, with the goal of having a better income, to provide their children with better education. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children.

To improve sales, Melencia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional merchandise to increase her product inventory. At an amount of PHP 10,000, she could already purchase more Vita Plus products like multivitamins, coffee, lotion and other products needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, she hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of succeeding and prospering in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week,  where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy Vita Plus products like multivitamins, coffee, lotion and other products that she can sell.

loans.name: Niyambala

texts.en:
Niyambala is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of three sons. She is from a small village of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district.  

Her husband, Buddhimohon, is a mason by profession, engaged with a shuttering business of centering work on houses. Centering is a type of framework where the temporary structure upon which the stones of an arch or vault are laid during construction. 

Niyambala is a housewife who always supports her family and her husband. She is active and energetic. She wants to go ahead and get over all the financial hurdles. They need to expand the business in order to strengthen their economic condition. Now, her husband wants to buy some tools and wood for his business. Niyambala has decided to help her husband and take a loan to purchase materials for the business.

So, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). With the help of the loan, her husband will be able to buy wood and necessary tools to prepare foundations for many houses. With the profit, she hopes to enhance her husband’s business and earn more, which will increase her family’s financial status. She wants to save money to construct a decent and better house with basic facilities for them.

Niyambala and her husband are thanking BJS and Kiva for supporting them financially.

loans.use: to purchase wood and necessary materials for her husband's shuttering business.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

Maria Fe has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Maria Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some beauty products that she uses in her daily work

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentin tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 04 hijos dependientes, vive con sus hijos y su conyugue, en el caserío de Ñuruñupe, distrito de san Felipe.

El caserío de Ñuruñupe es un caserío mediano el cual se encuentra ubicado a unos 60 minutos del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. En dicho distrito sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Valentin se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de maíz, el cual se encuentran con 25 días de sembrado, dichos productos son comercializados en el distrito de San Felipe, y se encuentran en muy buen estado, Valentin cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, además él se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar como son yuca, frejol, etc. los cuales son para su consumo, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y económicas, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz y así poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Valentin, age 41, is married and has four dependent children.  He lives with his children and his wife in the Ñuruñupe settlement in the San Felipe district.  The Ñuruñupe settlement is a medium sized settlement, which is 60 minutes from the Pucará district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

The main business activities in this district are agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  Valentin is a farmer, and he has corn crops, which have been planted for 25 days.  This product is sold in the San Felipe district, and the product is in very good condition.

Valentin has over ten years of experience in agriculture.  He also grows things like yucca and beans for their consumption.  He has very good personal and financial references.  The loan is to invest in the business by providing maintenance on the corn crop.  This way he will be able to get an acceptable profit in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to provide maintenance on the corn crop.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Teresa is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Teresa has a buy-and-sell sea cucumber business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sea cucumbers to sell.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sea cucumbers to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 39-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are currently in school. She has been raising livestock in the Philippines for five years.

Jocelyn has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business and is now requesting a PHP 20000 loan to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Regalada

texts.en:
Regalada works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Regalada requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Regalada has been in this business for 42 years now.

In the future, Regalada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 55-year-old married woman.

Her financially condition is not good; she has to think a lot time about starting any task. Now her son has just begun to drive a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being drive over local roads, and for small distances. He has been driving it over rough roads, which caused it to break down. Now the rickshaw needs to be replaced because it rattles when being driving. This is the reason he wants to buy new moto rickshaw.

Suriya has  requested a loan for her son so he can buy new moto rickshaw and can drive it smoothly. 

Suriya thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new moto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda  is 31 years old; she is married and she has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She has a kiosk and she is a businesswoman. She will to buy additional items  with the loan including  cooking oil, soap, milk, perfume, biscuits, candies,  SGM milk, sardines, combs, cigarettes, detergents and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

Fernanda opened her kiosk in 2009 with a working capital of $200. Now she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add  to her working capital to buy more goods. She is happy to be taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants her business to grow bigger in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, soap, milk, perfume, biscuits, candies, SGM milk, sardines, combs, cigarettes, detergents, etc

loans.name: Tsolmontuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsolmontuya, 38 years old, lives with her sister and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a grocery store for seven years. Her sister has a disability and stays at home, taking care of domestic work. Her daughter began going to secondary school. 

Tsolmontuya is requesting a loan of MNT 3,000,000 to buy a variety of candies in order to increase income. This business is the main income source of her family and she shows much concern for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a variety of candies in order to increase income.

loans.name: Evelin Del Transito

texts.es: Evelin de 34 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce (panadería) ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los precios y el pan siempre esta calientito al gusto del cliente, Evelin vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con el pan y sus tres hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, leche, miel, jaleas, etc. y así poder continuar con la elaboración del pan y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Evelin, 34, has worked for several years making and selling sweet bread (bakery) from her home.  She has many customers because of her prices and the fact that the bread is always warm like the customers like it.  Evelin lives in her own home with her life partner, who helps bake the bread, and her three children.  She is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, milk, honey, jellies, etc. so she can continue with her bread making activity and give her family everything they need without limitation.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast, milk, honey, jellies, etc.

loans.name: Narmeen

texts.en:
Narmeen is a 23-year-old single young lady from Deir el Balah. She lives with her family in a small house. Her mother works as an employee in the public sector where she gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Narmeen is a student in her last semester where she studies physiotherapy. She would like to take a BA degree and find a job in the future

Narmeen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Narmeen will be able to do her homework and write reports easily.

Narmeen appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio Fernando se sigue dedicando al negocio de agencia de viajes,el socio vende boletos turísticos a las diferentes personas del extranjero y también personas nacionales, el socio vende boletos para diferentes lugares como machupicchu y valle sagrado, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5 p.m, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener una agencia de viajes. El socio solicita le crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Fernando continues working in the travel agency business. He sells tourist tickets to different people from abroad and also local people. Fernando sells tickets for different places such as Machu Picchu and Sacred Valley. He works from 8:00am to 5:00pm. He has worked in this business for several years and it is going very well for him. His dream is to have a travel agency. He requests the loan to buy tourist tickets. Fernando is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill the payments.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin tiene 31 años de edad, vive solo en la casa de su madre, dedicado a la agricultura cultivando café, y criando ganado, la casa del cliente se encuentra en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Benjamin se dedica al cultivo de café, hace 5 años, en el Caserío de Ahuyaca. Él solicita crédito para la compra de abonos para realizar la fertilización de sus fincas y asi poder incrementar sus rendimientos. Benjamin posee experiencia en el negocio.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 31 years old, he lives alone at his mother's home. He makes a living farming, growing coffee and raising cattle. His house is located in the Colasay district of the Jaen province, a region of Cajamarca in the north of Peru. 

Benjamin has been growing coffee for the past 5 years in the Ahuyaca neighborhood. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to fertilize his crops and in this manner be able to increase his yield. Benjamin is experienced in the business.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers to fertilize his crops.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn is settled and lives in Guingona with her family. She grows a variety of crops in their tenanted land to earn a living. She sells their produce in the market and a portion is used for consumption. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. With her income, she was able to start up a retail business selling grocery goods in their village. To offer more goods, she took a new loan recently to purchase more grocery goods to sell.  She hopes to improve and expand her business in order to support the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines.

Cynthia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Cynthia has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Leonora has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Corazon is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Herodina

texts.en:
Herodina, a 40-year-old  married mother of three, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for four years now.  She has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain her business.

Herodina has requested a new loan for PHP 15000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana Dianira

texts.en:
Ana, con ayuda del préstamo anterior equipo mejor su negocio, logrando mantener la venta de tortillas y pupusas activas, las circunstancias familiares se mantienen y los ingresos han mejorado un poco.
En esta oportunidad el préstamo que solicita lo utilizara para comprar abono, dará un mejor trato a su cultivo de maíz, espera que la cosecha sea mayor, así estará abastecida con la materia prima para elaborar la venta.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn crops.

loans.name: Diocelyn

texts.en:
Diocelyn is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two children. With both children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

For two years now, Diocelyn has been running a general store in the Philippines selling a variety of items such as coffee, salt, sugar, canned goods, detergent soap and other groceries.  She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional such items.

In the future, Diocelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries such as coffee, salt, sugar, canned goods, detergent soap and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es: Maria  tiene 54 años,  está casada y tiene  4 hijos,  ella vive con su esposo, una hija y 2 nietas, en el lugar que reside Maria es de clima frio y ahí se dedica desde que era niña a la crianza de vacas,  su esposo se dedica al jornal de trabajo en el campo, Maria necesita el crédito para comprar  una vaca para aumentar a las vacas que ya tiene, comenta que es muy dura la vida en el campo ya  que ellos tienen su ganado en terreno que quedan muy retirado de la casa en la que viven, deben caminar una hora para llegar a ordeñar sus vacas, y de ahí cargan en su espalda la leche que sacaron y regresan a la casa para que el lechero retire esta leche, lo que Maria aspira en mejorar su negocio y a futuro comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Maria  is 54 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives with her husband,and two grandchildren.  The place where Maria lives has a cold climate and there she has been raising cows since she was a child.  Her husband works as a day laborer in agriculture.

Maria needs the loan to buy a cow in order to increase the number of cows she already has.  She says that life in the countryside is very hard as they keep their cattle on a piece of land which is quite far from the house where they live. They must walk for an hour to get to the place where they milk their cows, and from there they carry the milk on their backs and return home so that the mill seller can take away the milk.  Maria's ambition is to improve her business and someday buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Luz Nelida

texts.es:
Luz Nelida tiene 23 años, es soltera, vive en casa de familiares junto a sus 02 hijas. Es separada del padre de sus hijos. Vive en una comunidad rural dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el dsitrito y provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Luz Nelida se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral como borregos, chivos y aves de corral. Además, ella ofrece servicios en la empresa Mochenorte. Luz Nelida necesita del crédito para la inversión en compra de animales para negocio como borregos, chivos y pollos; con ello tendrá una mayor variedad de animales para atender pedidos y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Nelida is 23 years old and single.  She lives with her two daughters in a house belonging to relatives.  She is separated from the father of her children.  She lives in a rural community dedicated to commerce, agriculture, and livestock.  The community is in the district and province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Luz Nelida raises barnyard animals like sheep, goats, and poultry.  She also provides her services at the Mochenorte company.

Luz Nelida needs the loan to buy animals for her business.  She will buy animals like lambs, goats, and chickens.  With this, she will have a greater variety of animals in order to take care of orders.  This way she will be able to generate income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals like lambs, goats, and chickens.

loans.name: Erica Johana

texts.es: Erica es una señora de nacionalidad colombiana, vive en el campo y dice que en este lugar la fuente de ingresos solo es la ganadería y la agricultura, ella y su esposo trabajan en la cuadrilla o sea son personas que se reúnen en la mañana con su herramienta de trabajo (la pala) esperando que alguien  les lleve a trabajar, también se dedica desde hace  2 años a tener terneros y vaconas  para criarlos y de ahí tener otro ingreso, el crédito lo necesita para comprar una vacona, Erica aspira seguir trabajando para ahorrar y en algún momento comprarse una casita  para vivir con su esposo y su hijo que tiene 4 años.
texts.en:
Erica is a woman of Colombian nationality. She lives in the countryside and explains that there, the only source of income is cattle and agriculture. Her and her husband work as part of a "team" of workers, this means they meet in the morning with their work tool (the shovel) waiting for someone to put them to work. 
She has also been raising calves and cows for the past two years in order to have an additional income. She needs the loan to purchase a cow. 
She aspires to keep working in order to save up and eventually buy a little house to live in with her husband and their son who is 4 years old.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Fructosa

texts.en:
Fructosa, a 52-year-old widowed mother of two, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for five years now. Having received five previous loans from NWTF to sustain her enterprise, she is requesting a new one for PHP 10000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Fructosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fredline

texts.en:
Fredline is a second-year student at the Accra Polytechnic Institute, studying Purchasing and Supply, leading to an award of a Higher National Diploma. The loan is to help pay for her school fees.

Her mother has always been her source of inspiration. This is because she is hardworking, kindhearted, and religious. She is the kind who offers her help to people whenever the need arises, even if it is her last drop of blood, and this gesture pushes her to go higher in her education and render her support to whomever comes her way.

Fredline’s profession interests her because it teaches her how to cut costs in every facet of life. After her course, she should be able to support herself, as well as the people around her and those who might need her help one way or the other.

In the next five to ten years, she would want to head her own company or a multi-million company procuring goods from all over the world. The pursuit of this education would help her be more knowledgeable, confident, and independent. If Fredline is denied this loan, she will be affected psychologically because she would not be able to concentrate in class, since she will be thinking of ways to pay her fees. However, she would have asked friends or family members for help.

She would entreat the investors to keep up the good work and ask them to invest more in the country because Ghana has more viable investment opportunities.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is 44 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their four children. She usually sells food or rice in the morning. Since she is a breeder, she has a chicken farm beside her house.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6.000.000 rupiah. This loan is used for the improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home.
 
The sanitation will make her and her family have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Suryanti

texts.en:
Suryanti is 32 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children. She has one son (9 years old) and one daughter (3 years old). In this picture, she posed with her daughter.

She has a grocery shop for  increased family income. She was pleased to be able to help her husband to improve a better life.

Suryanti has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 IDR. This loan is used for the improvement of access to water and sanitation for  their family. She will  build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home. 

The sanitation will give her and her family better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet in her home to improve access to water and sanitation.

loans.name: María Amparo

texts.es:
María de 37 años de edad, es divorciada.

María tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de tamales y pan, aprendió de su madre que se dedicaba a la misma actividad. Todos los días se despierta a las 3:00 am para preparar  su producto para salir a venderlo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar maíz, hoja de plátano, harina, Azúcar, leña y demás para la elaboración de los tamales, además necesita reparar su vivienda que se ve deteriorada por las lluvias. 

Con el tiempo María espera logra que sus hijos terminen sus estudios puedan llegar a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and is divorced.  

María has worked for over 10 years in the sale of tamales and bread, which she learned from her mother, who performed the same work.  Every day she wakes up at 3:00 AM to prepare her product so that she can go out and sell it.

The loan will be used to purchase corn, banana leaves, flour, sugar, firewood, and other goods for making the tamales. She also needs to repair her home that was damaged by the rain.

In time María hopes to achieve her children finishing school and becoming professionals.

loans.use: to purchase corn, banana leaves, flour, sugar, firewood, etc. and to repair her home.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell for her buy and sell used clothing business. Elizabeth has been in this business for 18 years. Elizabeth earns more income from food vending and rice retailing.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Mauro Alfonso

texts.es:
Mauro de 53 años, por falta de recursos económicos en su familia, estudio hasta 5° grado de educación básica, esta casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, han procreado 3 hijos de 11 años de edad, 15 años de edad y 17 años de edad, todos estudian en 6° grado, 7° grado y 3° año de bachillerato respectivamente. Con Mauro solo viven su esposa y sus hijos y dependen de él.

Desde hace 30 años, Mauro se dedica a la crianza de novillos de repasto, aprendió con su padre que nunca tuvo una oportunidad de empleo formal y encontró en la crianza de los animales su única fuente de ingresos. Los animales son comprados en regular estado físico y luego de algún tiempo con buena comida se venden recuperados y a mejor precio del que se compro.

El préstamo sera utilizado en la compra de 3 novillos de repasto, para que después de un tiempo de pastoreo se puedan vender a buen precio y tener ingresos económicos para la alimentación y educación de su familia.

Mauro se proyecta que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria, para que puedan tener la oportunidad que él no tuvo cuando joven.
texts.en:
53-year old Mauro only attended school to grade 5 as he came from a poor family. He is married and his wife looks after the household. They have three children aged 11, 15, and 17. They are all students--in grades 6, 7, and 3rd year of high school respectively. Mauro has no other dependents.

For 30 years he has earned his living raising young cows, a job he learned from his father. He has never had the opportunity of a regular job. Raising cows is his sole source of income. He buys the cows in a mediocre state of health and then after a time and with good food, he sells the healthy animals at a much better price.

The loan Mauro is seeking is to buy three more cows. Then he can feed and treat them well and sell them at a profit. He will then be able to have a bigger income for the food and education of his family.

His wish is that his children will attend university and have the opportunities that he didn’t have when he was young.

loans.use: to buy three young cows to raise and fatten.

loans.name: Marìa Lucia

texts.es:
María Lucia tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a esposo e hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad, de familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de tumásn, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Lucia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales (cerdos, cuyes y gallinas). Su conviviente se dedica a brindar mano de obra agricola. Ella solicita crédito para la inversión en compra de animales y gastos de consumo diversos. Con ello tendrá una mejor atención a clientes y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Lucia is 32 years old and is married. She lives in a house that she owns with her husband and children, ages 10 and 12. They are a close-knit family. She lives in a community whose members make a living in commerce, agriculture, and livestock production. It is located in the Tumán district, province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

María Lucia makes a living raising and selling animals (pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens). Her spouse makes a living as an agricultural laborer. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of animals and for various expenses. With this loan, she will be able to provide better service to her customers so that she can earn money to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and pay for various expenses.

loans.name: Flor Del Paisaje Group

texts.en:
“Flor del Paisaje” (Flower of the Landscape) is a group of nine entrepreneurial women with great desires to better themselves and their families.  The group is located in the town of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Guatemala. Their level of formal education is about 2 ½ years.

Juana is 38 years old and a member of the group. She is very grateful for the opportunity to have a loan, especially since she is a single mother, which makes it difficult to get credit.  She has two children aged 17 and 13. Juana’s business is the buying, selling and production of textiles. In order to make her business more profitable and keep up with demand, she has employed two women from her community. With the microloan she is asking for, Juana plans to buy a large amount of thread – alpaca, wool, and silk. She is very excited that with more material she will be able to generate more revenue.

Juana looks forward to the new loan cycle because she will also benefit from  Friendship Bridge’s “Microcredit Plus” program which provides an invaluable education in business administration, marketing, budgeting along with learning about health, hygiene and self-esteem. She and the other women of “Flor del Paisaje” are very grateful to the Kiva investors who help make this program and microloans possible - a combination that provides very positive results.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of thread - alpaca, wool, and silk.

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary-Ann is 25 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mary-Ann is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, vitamins, feed and other supplies for her business.

Mary-Ann has been in the pig fattening business for one year and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, vitamins, feed and other supplies

loans.name: Tertuliana

texts.en:
Tertuliana is 60 years old and married with four children.

Tertuliana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Tertuliana has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Tertuliana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Union Y Paz Group

texts.es:
LISSETTE vive en San Lorenzo con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 10 meses de nacido. LISSETTE es huérfana de padre y madre desde que tenía 4 años de edad. a su padre lo asesinó la guerrilla y su madre murió un año mas tarde. LISSETTE fue criada con unos tíos en donde ha podido superar esta perdida de sus padres.  ha aprendido a trabajar y hoy en dia maneja un pequeño negocio con su suegra.- ella vende pollo ahumado, y comida preparada para la gente que se dedica a la concha y tiene que viajar muy temprano.
con este credito quiere implementar un nuevo negocio sin descuidar el actual. aprovechara que en el sector no hay venta de productos de visutería a bajo precio.
se considera una persona responsable, cariñosa trabajadora y con ideas de negocios en productividad.
conoce a los integrantes de su grupo y esta segura de trabajar con todos por mucho tiempo
texts.en:
Lissette lives in San Lorenzo with her husband and her 10 month old baby. Lissette is an orphan since she was 4 years old. Her father was murdered by the guerrilla and her mother died a year later. Lissette was raised by her uncles where she has overcome the loss of her parents. She has learned to work and today manages a small business with her mother in law. She sells smoked chicken and prepared food for people who work in the shell business and have to travel really early. 
With this loan she will implement a new business without neglecting her current one. She will take advantage of the fact that there is no sale of imitation jewelery products at low price in the area. She considers herself a responsible person, a kind worker and with productive business ideas. She knows the members of her group and is sure to work with them for a long time to come.

loans.use: purchase more chicken to sell it smoked and start an imitation jewelery business with low prices due to its uniqueness in the area

loans.name: Erdgie

texts.en:
Erdgie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and both of her children are in school.

Erdgie has a business selling seafood in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

In the future, Erdgie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Alliance Des Associations Haitiennes Pour L’Autono

texts.en:
Kynderly Alfred has been fighting to improve poor families’ conditions in his social work inside poor the neighborhoods of Port-au-Prince. With a lot of effort, within AHD, Kynderly started giving educational assistance to kids. He referred them to psychologists for counseling. The main teaching staff is composed of Bienca (the first on the left), Berline (second from the left) teaches 24-month-old kids and Magalie is a service woman devoted to this activity.Other teachers work o a weekly basis.
With a better space, Kynderly and his staff could improve the learning they are providing to the current 30 kids in Delmas 75. That is why he is seeking a loan from Zafen to buy construction bars and corrugated metal sheets to cover a much-needed space for the kindergarten. The AHD teaching staff consist of seven teachers and the school is operating in a small space. The loan will give an outstanding opportunity to the kids and the teaching activity.

loans.use: To buy metal bars and sheets to cover a space built for better learning.

borrowers.first_name: Alliance Des Associations Haitiennes Pour L’Autono

loans.name: Marie Solange

texts.en:
Marie Solange attended small art fairs with her parents in her childhood. After every fair, she would try to reproduce every single thing she saw. So, with her own creative spirit she started to make decorative art. In 2005, she decided to register her business and appeared in a fair held in Port-au-Prince. 

Marie Solange finds pleasure in making decorative art with coconut shells. She also produces picture frames, small and large decorative panels, lamp bases, candlesticks, flower pots, etc. She makes cabinets and other household items for home and office.  Today, to better satisfy the customers’ demand, the business needs a second loan to buy more raw materials such as paint, paintbrushes, and polish.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials (paint, paintbrushes, polish, coconut shells, etc.) to produce her art.

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en: Batdelger has used his previous loan for house renovation and now his family lives in a comfortable and warm place where they burn less coal for heating. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy planks in order to repair the fences surrounding his house. As a result, his land will be free of garbage. Garbage in the street is carried to his land by the wind through gaps in the fences. If there is no garbage on his land, his family will live in a cleaner environment.

loans.use: to repair his fences in order to live in a clean environment.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa Angelica es soltera, tiene 29 años de edad. Vive en casa familiar con madre y abuela, ella cuenta con buenas referencias personales y familiares. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Rosa Angelica se dedica a la venta de abarrotes(bodega) y a la venta de cerveza, en la zona de Cayalti. Desde hace más de 03 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para compra de mercaderia(abarrotes, golosinas, entre otros) lo que le va a permitir aumentar y diversificar su stock para poder atender los diferentes gustos de su público consumidor, lo que en un corto plazo le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de su vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Angelica is single, and she is 29 years old. She lives in the house of her family with her mother and grandmother. She has good personal and family references. She lives in an area where people mainly work in commerce, agriculture and cattle-raising. This community is in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Rosa Angelica works selling groceries (in a store) and beer in Cayaltí. She has done this job for more than three years. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (groceries, candy, etc.), which will allow her to increase and diversify her product range in order to cater for the different tastes of her customers. In the short term, this will increase her income, improve her profits and by this improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries, candy, etc.) in order to increase and diversify her product range.

loans.name: Segundo Jose

texts.es:
Segundo José tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Segundo José se dedica a brindar los servicios de albañilería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 11 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para compra y mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas de construcción, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Segundo José is 50-years old. He is married, has two children and lives with his family in a rural area of Oyotún District in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region. The area is on the northern cost of Perú.

Segundo José makes his living offering brick-work services. He has his own tools and more than eleven years of experience in the business. His business is located in his home. He is requesting the loan to purchase and maintain his construction equipment and tools. Said investment will serve him in improving the condition of his equipment and tools, which will have a great influence on his business. Segundo José plans to improve the productivity of his services and thereby meet the diverse needs of the customers in his area.

loans.use: to purchase and maintain his construction equipment and tools to improve the productivity of his business.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Cecille works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cecille is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Cecille has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock.

loans.name: Manale

texts.en: Manale is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. Because of her passion towards children, she decided to open a nursery inside her house in 2012. Daily, she welcomes children and spends her time with them pleasing them, taking care of them and feeding them. Today, Manale looks forward to borrowing a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase toys and secured small tables to provide a comfortable stay for her children while eating, playing etc. Manale believes that children always needs redecorations and that’s why she confirms that she will apply for more Kiva loans to be able to achieve that.

loans.use: purchase toys and secured small tables

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 40 años, es conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su conviviente y 04 hijos, desde hace 20 años. su familia unida. Viven en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltì, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Elvira se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral y además vende alfalfa y su esposo es obrero agricola. La inversión del crédito que se le otorgará será para comprar un mayor cantidad de animales para diversificar su stock y asi aumentar sus ventas, ya que podrá satisfacer los diferentes gustos de sus clientes y atender la demanda que tiene; con ello tendrá mayor ingresos, una mejor atención a clientes y así poder generar mejores ganancias que le permitan una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvira is 40 years old, and she has been living in her own house with her life partner and their 4 children for 20 years. Hers is a very close-knit family, and they live in a community whose inhabitants engage in retail, agriculture and livestock breeding; the community is located in Cayaltì, a district Chiclayo, a province of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

Elvira engages in breeding and selling farm animals, as well as in selling alfalfa; her husband is an agricultural laborer.

She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of a greater number of animals, in order to diversify her stock and increase her sales. This will help her satisfy her clients' needs and demand, increase her income and provide better care to her customers. She will consequently earn a better income that will help her improve her family’s standard of living as well as her own.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to diversify her stock and raise her sales by satisfying the different needs of her clients.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
