Raul tiene 33 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su madre, vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso ubicada en caserio Vista Florida distrito Santo Tomás, Raul es natural del caserio, él se lleva bien con los mienbros de su sector, caserio y pobladores del distrito de Santo Tomas; cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua; y esta ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Raul es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su segundo año de producción tiene 3 años de edad, cultiva café en caserio Vista Florida del distrito de Santo Tomas, actividad la realiza hace 5 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de cafe. Adicionalmente cria animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar.

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 has. De café en fase de brote floral, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Raul is 33 years old and he keeps a stable home with his mother. He lives in his own house of one floor, made of rustic material, located in the small village of Vista Florida in the Santo Tomás district. 

Raul was born in this village. He gets along well with the people in the village and district. He has good personal and work references in the area. His house is supplied with water services and is located in the Province of Cutervo of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Raul has been working for five years growing coffee in the village of Vista Florida of the Santo Tomás district. He has experience in coffee farming. Currently, he has two hectares cultivated with the variety Catimor which is resistant to disease. The plantation is three years old and in its second year of production.

Additionally, Raul raises small animals (hens, guinea pigs, pigs, among others) and also grows staple food crops.

The loan is for the maintenance and cultivation of two hectares of coffee now in floral bud stage, ensuring a good production for the 2015 market. This will result in increased sales volume and thus increased income. He will then be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain and cultivate two hectares of coffee now in floral bud stage, thus ensuring a good production for the 2015 market.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Rowena has been in this business for 4 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a special need client from Iraq. He is 45 years old, single, and he lives alone. 

Abbass owns a car spare parts shop. He established his business in 2013, but he has been working in this field for 15 years. He learned this profession from his dad and he has built up good experience. He is well-known in the surrounding area. 

Abbass is requesting a loan of USD 3,000 to pay the annual rent, buy an air conditioner, and install signage. He is aiming to further grow his business and expand his shop in the future, so he may increase his profits and make more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent, buy a split, and install signage.

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en:
Leonille is 63 years old. She is a single mother of five children ages 36, 34, 33, 32 and 27.

She operates her own business at one of Lusaka’s busiest markets. Her business deals in the sale of Coca-Cola products on wholesale to other small business  owners. The business is her only source of income. She has been in the business for four years and understands the importance of having enough empty crates to order additional drinks from the suppliers.

Leonille says her business is good, but the one thing holding her back is that she needs to increase her turnover by having more stock on hand. She explains how the number of drinks she can order is directly dependent on the amount of empty bottles and crates she has. If she can acquire more capital to purchase additional stock, this will help scale up her business and earn Leonille more profit. 

She is requesting a Kiva loan to help her increase her working capital, making sure that she is able to order more stock and increase her turnover.

She is hopeful that once she has more crates, her profit margins will increase by having additional turnover in the business. She hopes to use the profits from her business to expand her business and be able to help her family financially.

loans.use: to increase her working capital by buying more empty crates and bottles

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Mary. She is married and does not have children. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her because of schooling. In 2009, Mary established her clothing and slippers business. She began her business because she was not able to go further with her education since there was no money, so she decided to engage into business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Mary would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires this loan in order to buy more clothing and slippers of different kind for resale. 

In the future, Mary plans to continue her education into the university level. She is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics of different kinds for resale.

loans.name: Maa Pujharani Group

texts.en:
Anandini is the leader of a group lives in Tulapada of M. Rampur, Kalahandi, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 30 years. Her family comprises four members her husband and two sons, aged 5 and 3. The member standing first from the left in the second row, wearing a yellow-color sari, and showing her hand is Anandini.  

Like most families in the locality, she and her husband are running a rice huller repair shop in their house in M. Rampur. She receives the defective parts of hullers at home for repair. Her husband repairs them in the morning and evening time. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

Anandini’s husband goes to different huller units for repair work. Her husband also attends the calls of huller owners at the time of breakdown of the hullers. At present, her family’s income is Rs. 7,000 per month from her repairing unit. 

To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail herself of a loan from Mahashakti. With the loan amount, she will purchase some repairing instruments/machinery that will help in repairing hullers. She has a dream to have a mudhi (puffed rice) roaster and educate her children in a better school.

The other ten members of her group are Pragati, Hemalata, Umamani, Dharitri, Sita, Tarulata, Raibari, Kumari, Mithila, and Binodini, who are doing individual businesses in their village.

loans.use: to purchase instruments/machinery for her rice huller repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her taco stand by buying a tent to make it look more comfortable

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a 30-year-old married woman with two children.

Bebelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Bebelyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables.

Bebelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto has two jobs; he sells fruit in different Mexico City locations, and he also works doing shoe shines. He wants to focus on fruit sales and leave his shoe shining chair work to another person. He has been selling fruit for over 25 years and says that in the past he has taken different loans and always paid on time. 

Roberto is 52 years old and lives with his wife and daughter. His goal is to offer stability to his family, and help his daughter go to college.

loans.use: to sell fruits.

loans.name: Sari Madu Group

texts.en:
Sari Madu Group is very grateful that they could pass through the prior loan period with a successful loan. During the raising of the pigs, no problems were found. Pigs can grow big and healthy. They can sell them at a satisfactory price. Sari Madu Group members intend to continue lending in MUK because, in addition to providing loans, MUK also provides training and consulting from the vet for free.

Ni Luh managed to sell the piglets for a satisfactory price. Her sow gave birth to ten piglets, but two died. She earns IDR 150,000 in profit per piglet. The advantage is that she can save money to expand the business. She hopes that MUK will always accompany the group until all members are independent.

To continue the effort and increase the number of pigs, the Sari Madu Group went to the next loan. One member decided to stop borrowing after she had enough capital and she continues the pig business with her own money. These loans are used to purchase piglets, especially the superior species. The pig breeding business can help increase their family's income because of easy maintenance and it can be used as additional work. Most of the members work as farmers. 

In this period, Ni Luh's portion of the loan will also be used to support her husband to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Because Ni Luh, as the head of the Sari Madu Group, can”t come to the meeting due to illness, the client in the picture is Ni Ketut. 

Ni Ketut, as the Treasurer of Sari Madu Group, will use her portion of loan to purchase piglets and various kinds of seeds to plant in her garden. She hopes both of her businesses are going well and will give a satisfactory result.

Two of the members could not attend the meeting because of illness. The Sari Madu Group hopes this effort will be more advanced, so they could save money and send their children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and various kinds of seeds.

loans.name: Rafel

texts.en:
Rafel, 58, is a farmer from Iloilo, in the Philippines. He is married and the father of six grown children. 

Rafel raises cows, goats, chickens, pigs and carabao (water buffalo). He has been in this business for more than 40 years.

He is asking for a loan to buy more piglets, chicken and a cow. With this loan, he will be able to improve his business as well as his income. 

Rafel believes that this loan could really help him in making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, a chicken and a cow

loans.name: Helenore

texts.en:
Helenore settled for a living at Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She has been operating a motorcycle transportation service based business to earn a living for over six years running. The business is doing well, and she was able to successfully repay  her previous loan, which she used for purchasing tires and spare parts. She has been making savings for the future education of her children, and is determined to save more for that purpose. 

She took a new loan recently to cover the costs for motor registration and other licenses.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs for motor registration and other licenses

loans.name: Gertrudez

texts.en:
Gertrudez settled for a living at Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, with her family. She has been running a general store, selling a variety of groceries in their village while her husband is earning from his transportation services. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for buying goods. 

To offer more to her customers, she took a new loan recently from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. 

She hopes to generate, and save, more income for the purpose of having a comfortable house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie is 40 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lelanie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lelanie has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Lelanie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 58 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Estrella is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Estrella has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Laiza Paloma

texts.en:
Laiza Paloma is 34 years old and lives with her boyfriend as an unmarried couple. She has made a living as a catalogue merchant selling shoes to friends and acquaintances. She dreams to become financially stable by expanding her business to a bigger network of clients. 

She aims to continue and improve her business by selling more products on a weekly basis but lacks the capital to do so. For this reason, Paloma would like a loan of MXN3,500 to purchase more shoes to resell.

This is Laiza's first loan with Konfío. She considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and sell more shoes.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá, Honduras. She has been a corn farmer for 10 years. She is 32; she is married and has five children. It is clear that Maria works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, their children will be able to do their homework and improve the living conditions.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge cell phones, and save in traditional energy expenditure

loans.use: to purchase a Solar Home System for her home

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantuya, 40 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family income comes from her and her husband's taxi service. Also they sell flowers and souvenirs to graduating students during spring. 

The house they made an extension on two years ago has been deteriorating. So she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy hardwood floors, vacuum insulated windows and fiberglass for house renovation. As winter is approaching, it is necessary to install hardwood floors and vacuum insulated windows and insulate with fiberglass. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 65 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 6 children now of adult age. 
Juanita is in the nipa hut knitting business for 10 years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in supporting the financial needs of her son’s employment abroad particularly on passport and visa processing and traveling allowances.
Juanita has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Juanita hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To support the financial needs of her son’s employment abroad particularly passport and visa processing and traveling allowances

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en: Elyn has been helping her husband work on their farm to make a living. They make a good income and have successfully repaid the previous loans she used to buy farm supplies. With their determination to improve their farm, they work hard on it with GDMPC as their partner. She is thankful for the trust that the cooperative given to the small farmers who want to augment their living situation. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure, in order to restore farm nutrients. Greener pasture is her dream, and to improve the general living of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ella works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Ella is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice resale business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables. Delia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa is 48 years old and married with four children.

Dolorosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Dolorosa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net.

Marilou has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for maintaining her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Iyren

texts.en: Iyren is 25 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Iyren has a business selling home products in the Philippines. Iyren requested a 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of home products to sell. Iyren has been in this business for six years. In the future, Iyren would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of home products to sell.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Mrs. Hiep is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. Fishing is the main income of her family. She sells fish and has been in this business for 10 years. She has also daily income from garden such as chickens, ducks and vegetables. She is interested in improving the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is a 38 year old woman form Chiapas, who besides being a housewife is also an entrepreneur. Maria Elena lives in the poorest state in Mexico. That's why Maria Elena aspires to seek a better life for herself and her family.

Maria Elena has 6 kids, the oldest is 19 and the youngest is 5. She needs the loan to increase her cheese making business and engage her eldest son, into sustainable farming. 

Her husband and her eldest son will help her caring for the cows; meanwhile she will be in charge of producing the cheese. 

With the support of a NGO, Maria Elena and Mariano obtained the technical expertise to develop a silvopasture system. This project will improve the living conditions of their family and will contribute to the conservation of a high environmental value area.

She dreams to make a difference through her project in Villaflores, Chiapas.

loans.use: to buy four dairy cows and cheese making equipment

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Mrs. Hien is a hard working woman, 38 years old. She is married and has three children, who are still in school. Her income is mainly from husbandry and fishing. With more than 20 years experiences and the support from her husband, her income is able to repay the loan monthly as requested. She is interested to improve the living standard for her family and she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Crisales

texts.en:
Crisales owns and operates a jeepney unit. She has been successful in this business for three years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide her family's everyday needs and necessities.

Subsequently, Crisales would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 for the maintenance of the jeepney unit and to buy other materials needed in her business.

In the future, Crisales wants to have another jeepney unit and she hopes to sustain her business operation. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work. At the meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and make their microfinance loan repayments.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her jeepney

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 73 years old and a widow with ten children. Leonor works very hard to provide for them.

Leonor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leonor has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Leonor would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Genelyn has been in this business for six years. Genelyn earns more income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

Genelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Genelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Netty

texts.en: Netty is 42 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Netty is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Netty has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 39 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Evelyn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables. Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en: Remalyn is 26 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Remalyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Joseliza

texts.en: Joseliza is 58 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Joseliza has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy kitchenware and ingredients for her food business. She has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Joseliza would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida, Honduras. She is a livestock farming and breeds pigs. She is 53; she is a widow and has five children. 

The living conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. Maria hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to continue studying and improve their living conditions.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting and save in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Veronica works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from growing vegetables and raising pigs. Veronica is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her food production business.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Mui

texts.en: Mrs. Mui is a hardworking woman, 35 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and fishing. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Mrs. Thanh is 51 years old. She lives with her husband and her son. Cultivation and husbandry are her main income. She has daily income from her garden and vegetables, chicken and pig. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improving the health for her family as well as environment protection.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Mrs. Linh is 29 years old. There are four people in her family. Fishing and small business are the main income source of her family. She can cover her family’s daily costs and education from selling fish, which her husband caught. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina, who is 49 and the mother of an only child, runs a food vending service in order to make a living. While her husband works on their farm, Divina finds ways to support and sustain their living. She started her business many years ago, and it is earning income for their daily expenditures. 

To offer more, Divina took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her cafeteria to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Moises Ricardo

texts.es:
Moises es un joven muy estudioso, soltero con 18 años, trabaja brindado clases de matemáticas en una academia de su ciudad natal, Chincha. Es muy inteligente y quiere convertirse en un gran profesional más adelante, es por ello que está estudiando la carrera de Administración y Finanzas en la universidad de su ciudad y cree que le va muy bien por la dedicación que le pone al estudio y las ganas que tiene de salir adelante.
Moises está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá pagar la mensualidad de la universidad y de esta manera seguirá continuando con sus estudios de manera normal. Así sin ningún inconveniente, más adelante espera convertirse en un gran profesional y lleva una especialidad en Finanzas.
texts.en:
Moises, 18, is a studious, young man who is single and works offering mathematics classes in an academy in his hometown Chincha.  He is very intelligent and wishes to become a great professional later on.  For this reason, he is studying for a career in administration and finance at the university in his city and he believes that things are going well because of the dedication that he puts into his studies and the desire he has to get ahead.
Moises is very thankful to the Kiva investors because with the support they have offered him, he will be able to make the monthly university payments and in this way he can continue his studies in a normal way.  Thus without any inconveniences, later on he hopes to become a great professional and specialize in finance.

loans.use: to pay the university registration.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 60 years old and widowed with three children. 

Leonor earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Leonor has been farming sugarcane for 25 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs.

Leonor is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leonor is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en: Virgenia is 55 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, sanitary pads, toothpaste, candies, etc. to sell. Virgenia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 34 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables.  She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is 61 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Lucita has a business selling footwear in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of footwear to sell. Lucita has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Lucita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of footwear to sell.

loans.name: Klenile

texts.en: Klenile works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her business. Klenile has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Klenile would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analiza is 37 years old and three of her children are currently in school. Analiza has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. Analiza has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Agustinha

texts.en: Agustinha is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including sugar, coffee, sardines, candies, salts, medicine, detergent and other things to sell including soft drinks. She is married and she has no children.  She is a businesswoman. She has been doing business since 2007 with her own working capital of $500. So now she is taking a loan of USD 800 to improve her business.  She wants to open a big store in the future. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies to sell like sugar, coffee, sardines, candies, salts, medicine, etc.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.es:
Joselito vive en casa propia de material rustico, es soltero, no cuenta con ningun hijo en su poder, tiene 15 años radicando en la zona, tiene muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad, la misma que esta ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. En dicha comunidad la población se dedica basicamente a la agricultua, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad a la que se dedica Joselito es a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña ubicado en el caserio Cabra Chica - Pucara, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, el préstamo que se le otorgara lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Joselito lives in his own house of rustic materials, is single, and has no children to take care of.  He has lived in his area for 15 years and has good references both personal and from work in his community which is located in the Pucara District, Jaen Province, Cajamarca Region of the northern mountains of Peru.  In this community, the population makes a living basically from agriculture, cattle ranching and commerce.
Joselito makes a living from agriculture, specifically from the cultivation of pineapple in the hamlet of Cabra Chica - Pucara.  He has ten years experience doing this.  The loan that will be offered to him he will use in his agricultural work for applications and incorporations of plant health products, fertilizers and labor for his harvest.  In this way, it will help him improve his crop physiologically, morphologically, and productively so that he will also obtain an opportune harvest.  Finally, he will have better production and a better quality product so that he won't have problems selling his product.

loans.use: to utilize in his agricultural work for applications and incorporations of plant health products, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en:
Zaldy is a 49-year-old fisherman from the town of Carles in Iloilo. He is a widower with a son who is 17 years old. 

Zaldy is requesting a loan to buy ropes, fishing nets and fishing weights in order to sustain his livelihood. A few months ago, Zaldy was struggling to put his life back in order after the typhoon Haiyan ravaged his area. 

This loan will be instrumental as he'll be able to further sustain his business while also supporting his son. The income will help him buy food and pay for household bills. In the future, he hopes to have a bigger business which will allow him to earn better income for him and his son.

loans.use: to buy ropes, fishing nets and fishing weights.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is 50 years old and has five children.  She is married and four of her children are in school. Melanie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Melanie has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Trinsie

texts.en:
Trinsie is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are in school. Trinsie is in the agricultural business,  farming vegetables in the Philippines. Trinsie requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Trinsie has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Trinsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a coconut leaves roofing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Elvie has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Elvie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is a 47-year-old, widower from the town of Carles in Iloilo. He has three children, the oldest of which is 23 and the youngest is 13. Nestor has provided for them by being a fisherman for 15 years now. At the moment he needs help so he can buy more fishing materials to replace those that are already torn and worn. This is also to replace those that were lost during Typhoon Haiyan many months ago. Nestor works hard for his livelihood since this is the only work that he knows best, and what motivates him are his children. His income will provide good food for his family and reinvestment in the same business.  He hopes to give his children a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, rope and fishing weights.

loans.name: Aracelly Lizeth

texts.es:
Aracelly es una mujer emprendedora de 27 años, soltera y con muchos deseos de superación. Estudió la carrera de Enfermería  y actualmente ejerce su profesión en un Policlinico de su ciudad, ella cree que le va bien en todo porque siempre se esfuerza, trabaja por más de 10 horas y porque es muy responsable.
Aracelly está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su domicilio, de esta manera sus comidas se mantendrán por más tiempo en buen estado y así mejorará su calidad de vida. Con esto Aracelly seguirá luchando día a día por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Aracelly is a resourceful woman aged 27; she is single and she has big dreams for her life. She studied to become a nurse and she is currently working in this capacity in a general hospital of her town. She esteems things are going well because she is always doing her best, working more than 10 hours a day, and because she is very responsible.
Aracelly is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy a fridge or her house, so her food will be preserved for a longer time and in good conditions, and her standard of living will improve. Thanks to this Aracelly will keep on fighting on a daily basis for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for her house.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en: Pilar is 39 years old and married with five children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Pilar has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. Pilar aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marcial Wenceslao

texts.es:
Marcial es un padre de familia dedicado, trabaja como empleado en una empresa de su ciudad natal, Lima.
Su buen desempeño en el trabajo es el resultado de todo el empeño que le pone a su labor, las ganas con las que hace cada cosa y a la experiencia que ha podido adquirir a lo largo de los años. Cada mañana, despierta con la motivación de sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles un futuro mejor.
Marcial está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa, ya que a sus hijos les encanta bailar, así estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando cada día por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcial is a dedicated father who works as an employee in a business in the city where he was born, Lima. His good performance in his work is the result of the effort that he puts into his work, his positive disposition with which he does everything, and the experience that he has been able to acquire over the years.

Every morning he wakes up with the motivation of helping his family get ahead and providing them a better future. Marcial is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they provide he will be able to buy sound equipment for his home, as his children love to dance. In this way he will be improving his quality of life and be able to continue striving every day for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to paint the walls of his room and to buy a mattress and bed.

loans.name: María Melba

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 82 años de edad, hace varios años su marido falleció pero de esta relación tiene 8 hijos  mayores de edad, ella vive con una hija.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y con su esfuerzo poder solventar los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad  como granos, legumbres, plátano y ciertas bebidas, allí ella también vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), lleva más de 25  años con su tienda la cual la tiene desde que vivía su querido esposo.
Este crédito es para comprar productos Avon y víveres para surtir su tienda. Lleva 3 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan en  su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una tienda más grande y surtida.
texts.en:
The Group "Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi province, known for its rich precolonial culture and its artisan works are recognized nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous straw hats.

Here is where 82 year old Maria lives. Several years ago her husband passed away. They have 8 grown children, and she lives with one of her daughters. Maria is a woman who likes to be successful and with effort she can pay her own household expenses. She has a small convenience store in her home, where she sells all kinds of basic needs items such as grains, vegetables, plantains, certain beverages, and also Avon products (beauty products such as cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women). She has had her store for over 25 years, since when her husband was still alive.

This loan is to buy Avon products and supplies to stock her store. She has been in the credit group for 3 years and she likes it because the loans help her business. Her dreams are to have a bigger and better stocked business.

loans.use: to buy Avon products and supplies.

loans.name: Tricy

texts.en:
Tricy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Tricy is 43 years old and all of her children are in school.

Tricy has a general store business in the Philippines. Tricy requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries.

Tricy has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Tricy would like to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a basket-weaving business in the Philippines. Elizabeth has been in this business for five years now.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, age 43, lives in Kapiri Mposhi, Zambia. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump to help him irrigate and expand his garden crops.

Last season, Samuel grew cabbage and maize, drawing water by hand from a nearby well in order to irrigate them. This season, he has big plans to expand his production, and will need a water pump in order to keep up with the irrigation required during Zambia’s dry season.

Rent-to-Own will deliver a water pump directly to Samuel's farm. Rent-to-Own also provides Samuel with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off the loan.

With a water pump Samuel will be able to reduce the time he spends watering his crops, and will no longer have to draw water by hand.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Boodhari Group

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 54-years-old man and he lives in Hargiesa, Somaliland. He is a responsible father of 9 children. Ahmed is the one who standing the left side of the photo group rising his hand.

He owns a fishery shop in the Jama Gunti market. He has been running his fishery shop for the last 6 years. He buys fish from Hargiesa and Berbera and sells the fish in his shop to his customers.  

Ahmed is the leader of group known as Boodhari which consists of 12 members, six men and six women. All the group's members need to expand their medium and small business. Ahmed also wants to expand his fishery shop and he requests a loan of $500 from Kaaba Microfinance.

loans.use: to expand his fishery shop.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Gina has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional material and gear for her business.

Gina has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional material and gear for her business.

loans.name: Adriana Gabriela

texts.en:
Adriana Gabriela is 30 years old and lives with her husband in an apartment. Together they run a small online shop selling men's and women's clothes, accessories, and makeup. Her dream is for the shop to grow in order to become financially stable and expand her business by opening branches where her family can work.

She aims to establish her shop in a formal setting but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, Adriana would like a loan of MXN5,000 to pay for an initial investment to open the shop.

This is Adriana's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to set up a clothes shop

loans.name: Abdirahman

texts.en:
Abdirahman is 46 years old and lives in Gabiley, Somaliland. He is a responsible father of four sons and four daughters. He owns a fish shop in the Gabiley and Wajaale markets. He has been running his fish shop for the last 5 months. He buys fish from Hargiesa and Berbera and sells the fish in his shop to the customers in both Gabiley and Wajaale towns. The number of clients has increased due to his good services to his clients. 

Moreover, he is the sole earner in his family so he wants to increase his income. In this way, he will be able to meet his family's requirements. He is a very honest and hard-working man. He behaves politely to his customers and other people. He sells 110 kilos of fish per day and each kilo is $5.He has two banches one in Gabiley and the other in Wajaale. Now he wants to expand his fish shop and he is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Kaaba Microfinance.

loans.use: To expand his fish shop.

loans.name: Gamil Group

texts.en:
Nimco is 40 years old and lives in Hargeisa City, Somaliland. She is married and has five children who are all in school. 

For the past two years, Nimco has been working hard to manage her clothing and electronic supermarket which sells clothes and electronic in Hargeisa. She is the one at the left side of the group photo. She is the leader of group known as Gamil. The group consists six members, three  female and three male members. This group was a pre-existing group, as the members of this group are co-owners of a Supermartket in Hargeisa.

To help expand their Supermarket, Nimco and her group members have requested a loan of $4200. Although each member will take $700, all the money will be invested their co-owned business.  

The loan will be used to buy more electronics, and will help Nimco and her group to generate greater profits and increase their working capital. 

They hope that in the future, they will be able to open up another branch or to enlarge this existing one.

loans.use: to buy more electronics

loans.name: Huê

texts.en:
Mrs. Huê works in agriculture, farming food.  Huê has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Huê is 51 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Huê lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Huê’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Huê faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet.

Huê hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet.

loans.name: Desederia

texts.en:
Desederia is 51 years old and the mother of three children.  She has been running a general store for over three years to earn a living.  She also has a farm, which is their main source of income.  Her store helps her meet their daily needs. 

She took out a new loan from GDMPC in order to purchase additional grocery items to sell.  In the future, she wants to expand her business as well as to operate a greener farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Etna Azucena

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Etna, tiene 87 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esta relación tiene una hija mayor de edad  que vive con ella junto a su esposo y sus nietos que son su felicidad.
Doña Etna es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante por sí misma y sin depender de nadie es así y por eso que se dedica al comercio, ella vende una gran variedad de productos como ropa, zapatos, bolsos, cremas, perfumes, carteras, bisuterías y muchas cosas más,  la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa y su hija le ayuda con esto en ciertas ocasiones, su mercadería se la traen de Panamá la cual es de muy buena calidad y al gusto de sus clientes, ella lleva más de 20 años con su negocio con el cual sale adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, carteras, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería entre otras cosas vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi province. This area is known for its precolonial architecture and its artisan works are known nationally and internationally. It is also the home of the famous straw hats.

87 year old Etna lives here. She is divorced, has a grown daughter who lives with her along with her current husband and seven grandchildren who are her every happiness. Etna is a woman who has always liked to support herself and not depend on anyone. So she worked as a vendor, selling a variety of items such as clothing, shoes, purses, creams, perfumes, wallets and other items. The majority of her sales she does in her home with her daughter occasionally helping. She brings her merchandise from Panama, and it is of good quality and her customers like it. She has had her business for over 20 years.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, wallets, shoes, perfumes, and other items to sell. She has been in this credit group since it started and she likes it because of the help she receives through the loans. Her dreams are to have good health and continue moving forward into the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing, wallets, shoes, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: La Estancia  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Estancia está formado por 9 mujeres quienes a diario luchan para mejorar sus negocios y los ingresos para sus hogares, su objetivo es sacar en adelante a sus familias,  viven por el cantón Paute el mismo que es reconocido por estar allí construida la hidroeléctrica más grande el país, es de clima cálido en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la floricultura y al cultivo de varias frutas como manzanas, peras etc.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jenny, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, su esposo labora como operador de maquinaria pesada, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Jenny  pasa en casa cuidándoles de sus pequeños hijos, pero le ayudarle a su esposo en la economía de su hogar se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de hortalizas las que vende en su cantón, también se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y ganado. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y en abono para sus cultivos. Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser  profesionales.
La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The credit group "La Estancia" consists of 9 members who daily work to improve their businesses and income for their homes. The objective is to support their families into the future. They live in the Paute province, which is known for its hydroelectric plant, which is the largest in the country. The weather is hot and the majority of the population in this area works in growing flowers or fruits such as apples, pears, etc.

One of this group's members is 21 year old Jenny. She is married and has two children ages 4 and 2. Her husband works as a fishing machine operator, and they live in their own home. Jenny takes care of the small children, but she helps her husband with the household income by farming. she grows crops that she sells in her province, and she also raises chickens, guinea pigs, and cattle.

The money will be used to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and fertilizer for her crops. Her dream is that her children grow up to be professionals. The small photo is of two members that couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: This is Joyce. She is a small scale farmer in Uasin Gishu county, Kenya. She is married with five children; three girls and two boys studying in primary and secondary school. She undertakes farming of passion fruits and rearing of dairy cows.To pay the high fees requirements for her children, Joyce intends to raise her income by expanding her passion fruit farming activities. A loan from Kiva will help Joyce pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy inputs and expand her passion fruits farm.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: This is Stephen. He is married and is blessed with two sons aged three and thirteen years. He comes from Kiambu, Kenya where he is involved in dairy and vegetable cultivation. He has plans of becoming a prominent dairy farmer but his biggest obstacle is raising adequate capital to propel his income generating activities. Stephen will use the loan to build a vegetable stand for his wife, improve cowshed and buy a calf. Stephen would have preferred buying a dairy cow to a calf but he does not qualify for a bigger loan. A loan from Kiva will help Stephen embark on the journey of becoming a prominent dairy farmer.

loans.use: construct a vegetable stand for his wife, improve his cowshed and buy a calf.

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en: Jorenda lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga with her family. Her husband works as a security guard while she operates her own retail store. She is now earning a better income from her business and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods. Jorenda recently took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to offer to her customers. She always finds ways to augment the family's living and works hard to have a sustainable income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Renson Ronald

texts.es:
Renson es un padre de familia amoroso, tiene 31 años y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Trabaja como vigilante en una empresa, se despierta muy temprano y labora por más de 10 horas al día porque quiere brindarle a su hija todas las comodidades que él no pudo tener por falta de algunos recursos económicos, así que no quiere que su hija tenga necesidades. Renson cree que le va bien por su constante esfuerzo, su empeño, responsabilidad y humildad.
Renson está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá hacer algunas mejoras de su hogar como reforzar las paredes ya que en esa zona hay temblores con frecuencia y quiere prevenir y que su familia esté segura. Gracias a esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Renson is a caring family man, he is 31 and he lives in Ica close to his family. He works for a company as a security guard, he gets up very early and works for more than 10 hours a day because he wants to grant his daughter all the commodities he could not enjoy for lack of economic resources, and he does not want his daughter to have any uncared for needs. Renson esteems things are going well because he constantly does his best, and because of his commitment, his responsibility and his humbleness.
Renson is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support will be able to make some improvements to his house, such as reinforce the walls, as there are many earthquakes in the area where he lives ad he wants to prevent damages and makes sure his family is safe. Thanks to this, he will improve his standard of living and he will keep on fighting for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To reinforce the walls of his house.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 64 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de zaña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Alfredo se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como borregos y chivos, desde hace más de 20 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en el anexo de San Nicolas. Él solicita préstamo para la ampliación de sus corrales, construir más corrales para la crianza y alimento de los mismos. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 64 years old, married, lives with his wife in their own home in a small rural community in the Zaña area. He enjoys good personal references and recommendations from his neighbors. The community is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Alfredo raises and sells livestock such as sheep and goats. He has been in this business for more than 20 years. He seeks a loan to expand his corrals, build more corrals for his livestock and to buy feed for his animals. In this way he can grow his business, obtain greater income and be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to expand his corrals, build more corrals for her livestock, and livestock feed.

loans.name: Maria Luzgarda

texts.es: María  está casada, tiene 54 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, de los que una de 23 años que padece de una enfermedad  vive con ella, Maria se dedica desde que era niña al cuidado de las vacas ya que su familia vive en el campo, el esposo de Maria trabaja en la agricultura y a veces también se va de chofer, ella va a invertir el crédito en la compra de un ternero para mejorar su negocio y de ahí aspira seguir trabajando  para tener una vejez digna.
texts.en: Maria, 54, is married and has four children, one of which is a 23 year old who suffers from an illness and lives with her.  As her family lives in the country, Maria has been engaged in caring for cows ever since she was a young girl.  Maria’s husband works in farming and sometimes also as a driver.  She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of a calf to improve her business and from there, she hopes to continue working in order to have a dignified old age.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Carmin

texts.en:
Carmin is 65 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Carmin has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in business for 20 years. Carmin has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to stock and sell.

In the future, Carmin would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to stock and sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita lives in Viqueque and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities since 2014. She started with her own working capital of $700. She has a kiosk, so she is taking a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin which she will use to buy additional supplies to keep in her store including candles, milk, biscuits, eggs, soap, aqua, razors, slippers, sewing cotton, cigarettes, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell. She wants to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business and to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: to buy candles, milk, biscuits, eggs, soap, aqua, razors, slippers, sewing cotton, cigarettes, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 60-year-old woman with three adult children. She is from Carles, Iloilo. Last year, typhoon Haiyan greatly affected her source of income, which is fishing. She has had this business for 20 years now. This has been her very source of income when providing for her children. Milagros continues to persevere and is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fishing nets. She hopes that with the help of her loan she can go back to having a steady and reliable income to meet their daily needs for food and so that she can pay the other household bills.

Milagros also dreams of improving her income from fishing and also savings for her golden years.

loans.use: to  buy fishing nets

loans.name: Tan Group

texts.en: Tan is 55 years old, a farmer and a married woman with four children, living in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1999. Her husband is 61 and also a farmer. Three of her children are workers and another is a student. Together, they can earn approximately $17 daily. Now Tan would like to request a loan as a group of three members and she will use her portion to buy foundation parts for a latrine. This loan will help her and her family live in better conditions. In the future she is going to fatten animals, renovate her house and support her youngest child to go to university.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts for a latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a wardrobe and a TV set for her house.
